review.reviewBody: Been using this for a few years now on my mountain bikes.  I've tried cheaper and more expensive lubes, and this is my go to.
review.name: Really good at reasonable price

review.reviewBody: I used this lube for more than a year in my road and mountain bikes, it clean and lubricante the chain at once. I used to put the chain in a jar with a strong degreaser, rinse and wash with soap, dried, install in the bike and when I used this lube the rag get really dirt. I lubricante the chain twice, the second time the rag is cleaner. Usually the chain last 2,000+ miles in the road bike.
review.name: Good for Road or MTB

description: Buy the Black Diamond Stormline Stretch Rain Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stormline Stretch Rain Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Stormline Stretch Rain Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great pants. I'm an 8/M so I ordered an M. If they were all I was wearing, or over a base layer or leggings, they would work. But I wanted them to fit over hiking pants so I exchanged for a large.
review.name: Size depending on how you want to wear

review.reviewBody: Really like how confortable those rain pants are but I can't undo the snaps at the bottom of pants, scared to rip the fabric if I keep trying. Help, please!
review.name: Women's Stormline Stretch Rain Pants / Snap problem?

review.reviewBody: I don't normally write reviews, but was compelled to after a recent trip to Iceland. I purchased so many pairs of rain pants from so many different brands, which I tested in the shower before the trip, and ultimately decided on the BD Stormline Stretch and I'm so glad I did. The beginning of the trip rained for 5 days straight, and on one of the longer hike days with heavy rain and out for the full day, I was completely dry and comfortable. They were so easy to put on, didn't have the crunchy swish swash of normal rain pants, they breathed really well, and were so lightweight, packable,and comfortable, I ended up living in these daily with thermals underneath for the entire trip. The pants also do super well for blocking the wind, which is also a constant in Iceland. I normally wear a size small, but went with the medium to have a higher waist and room for layers underneath, and had plenty of room to move my knees and legs while moving and hiking. One of the best purchases for keeping me dry, thank you Black Diamond. An absolute must for wet weather!!
review.name: Could not have made it in Iceland without these!!

review.reviewBody: Questionable durability, but great waterproofing, even better fit and very lightweight.
review.name: Nice!

review.reviewBody: And a little stretchier than most zero-stretch rain paints. Plus not so shiny as most plastic-like rain paints. Bravo!
review.name: Slimmer fit than most horrendously baggy rain paints.

review.reviewBody: These pants were tested on a recent trip to Patagonia in March. Rain fear is essential here this time of year and Black Diamond kept me dry while hiking and kayaking. I recommend full zip!
review.name: Black Diamond Rain Pants for the Win

review.reviewBody: These pants are much more flattering than most of the others I tried on. I have not tested them in the rain yet but they feel lightweight and could easily be rolled up into a backpack to toss on in the event of rain during a hike or climbing day. The material feels nice and durable.
review.name: Form fitting, comfortable, all around good rain pant

review.reviewBody: The stretch fabric is perfect and makes for a great fit. Very happy with these rain pants.
review.name: just what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: I really want to like these rain pants - they're comfy and long enough for my 33 inch inseam legs, but they just don't work with hiking boots.  Even with the zippers on the legs, I can't get them on and off over my boots.  I wear a size 9 boot, so if you have smaller feet, you might be able to, but you're still going to get mud all over the inside of the pants.
review.name: Useless for Backpacking, Otherwise Great

name: Stormline Stretch Rain Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Like other mesh baselayers (Brynje), it works fantastically for activities that mix high energy output with slower, colder moments.
XC skiing, under a thin, very breathable wind-shell,  it never once felt wet. And thats despite big variations in energy uitput between uphills and descents.

Since it worked much better than my other baselayers, I wore it every day, yet the merino content and mesh construction kept it smelling civilized.

Fit is great. It is very stretchy and the sleeves are a decent length. It feels fine against the skin.
review.name: Keeps you dry, fits great

review.reviewBody:
Before jumping into the review let me provide some background. I used this base layer on a sunny 40F day beneath my Alpha Ros Jacket. I typically run cooler so I prefer to add some extra layers to stay warm. During my ride I rode a decent mix between fast flats and steep climbs. 

Now, onto the review. The base layer kept me just warm enough when paired with the jacket. There were a few times where I felt some chills going down hill or while in a shaded canyon. However, what surprised me the most was how warm it kept me under the jacket.  Where my old base layer slowly collected sweat under my jacket and began to amplify the cold after a while, this base layer did an amazing job of providing enough warmth while allowing my sweat to evaporate off of my skin. This alone meant that while I started the ride on the colder side I was quickly able to warm up and stay warm, even after the climbs where I had been sweating. Instead of having to wait for my old base layer to dry out, this new one just stays dry. 

I was really skeptical of this base layer adding anything to my winter riding experience, but it has turned out to be a pretty amazing piece of kit, especially when you find yourself on a route with some serious sweat points. 

For sizing, it runs typical Castelli. A Large fits perfectly @ 6'1" 175lbs.
review.name: Deceptively Effective

name: Miracolo Wool Long Sleeve - Men's

review.reviewBody: I use it 30-40 minutes 2-3 times a week. I generally have it on the flash setting and it lasts several weeks before I have to charge it. No issues with it so far.
review.name: Going strong 1 year on

review.reviewBody: I chose this light because it sits above my bars and doesn't interfere with a handlebar bag. After a few rounds of charging, it started to get finicky (meaning I had to jiggle it to connect properly) and now it won't charge at all.  I've had it too long now to return it, so it's garbage. Disappointed because I've always had good luck with Lezyne products. Replaced it with a Night Rider Swift 300, hoping to have better luck with the more typical micro USB charger.
review.name: Good idea, but...

name: KTV Drive Headlight

description: Buy the Fjallraven Keb Gaiter Long Trouser - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Keb Gaiter Long Trouser - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Keb Gaiter Long Trouser - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really need these in dark olive colour. Best trousers in the world.

Been using them all summer cause perfect with zip off feature. And been warned all keb models do loosen a little in the waist after alot of use so better it fits snuggly then too loose when new. And this model is long 34 inch leg length and as a person that is normal 32 inch leg, i got a local seamtress to hem it up as its a easy job to do since no zipper ventilation on the zip off legs. So can even make them shorter as well. But i do hope they will update leg length on more zip off pants in the future. Will buy a second pair for sure in the future.
As i live in all my Keb pants.
review.name: Best all year zip off pants.

review.reviewBody:
Request for Keb Gaiters Trousers in Regular 32 Length.

The Fjllrven Keb Gaiters Trousers are excellent and versatile just like all the other Keb Trousers. The only issue I have is that there are only offered in one length, and that length is Long at 34 and no where does it state the actual length. I have been requesting Fjllrven to offer the Keb Gaiters Trousers in a Regular 32 length and Im sure there are guys and gals that would like to see them in a Short 30 length as well here in the States. Im nowhere near a Fjllrven retail store for their tailor to make alterations, but the bottoms of the Keb Gaiters Trousers are so technical that an alteration will never be like factory and for $255 price tag it doesnt make sense to butcher a brand new pair of adventure pants. Also the articulating knees may not lineup properly depending on your leg length. So hopefully Fjllrven will finally offer Regular and Short lengths soon. 

There is no outer knee pocket to put kneepads in the trousers which is fine, but I would like to see lower leg ventilation added. The zip-off gaiter portion is in-genius and can come in handy if necessary, very smart design. I would like to see all the Keb Trousers carabiner belt loops have 1 cm of added length to make it less fiddly to get a carabiner in the very small loops.
review.name: Request: Regular 32 Length needed!

review.reviewBody: I've had these pants for 6 weeks now and they have quickly become the item that I reach for whenever I'm heading out for a hike on the trail, camping with the family or a cold morning trek with the dog. I'm 5'10 160 lb and size 48 was spot on! The detail and construction on these trousers is "best in class".  The stretch material provides flexibility in all the right places,   have plenty of room in the pockets for storage, allow you to regulate temperature with the added zippers, and the gaiter hooks are always helpful in keeping debris out of my boots.  These are a must have item, well done Fjallraven!
review.name: A Must Have Item!

review.reviewBody:
I own the F80808R (Regular, i.e., shorter) version in Dark Navy - Uncle Blue color. The pants have an excellent fit; they do not limit my freedom of movement and comfortable to wear all day. Also, they look good on me. The utility features, e.g., pockets are great.

The waxing does not make the pants as water repellent as I expected, but when wet they dry really quickly. The pants are warm enough for me to hit 0 degrees (Celsius), below that I need a thin base layer. If the weather gets warmer (20C) the air gets easily trapped and the pants feel really warm. But the vents help. When zipped off and with vents open, the shorts feel okay even in 30-35C.

Waxing the pants I find more annoying than I expected. Because of the high price and bad breathability I would give 4 stars so far, but there is something that really kicks me off balance. That is: the fabric fades super quickly during sunny days.

How fast? I bought the trousers brand new. I spent 1-week in them in a summer camp/festival as shorts (very sunny), then I used them in the city for 1 month during the summer (mostly indoors, but again as shorts). I washed them 3 times (zipped-on). In the end, the upper part really changed color (disturbingly visible) compared to the lower part and that broke my heart and excitement towards these pants. I would not buy it again. In the forest, I don't care, but I planned to wear these in the city, too. That might have been just my bad expectations.
review.name: Great Fit, Poor Color Retention

review.reviewBody: These trousers are well designed and thought out, well made, and fit well and true to size. If one is looking for a shell pant that may also serve as shorts or provide ventilation, and have a pair of gaiters as a bonus, then look no further. They are well constructed and the materials are tough where needed yet forgiving for comfort and flexibility. For size reference, 61, 175 lbs, and 32 waist and 32 inseam. The Regular size in this trouser fits well if the gaiter is not fastened on a hiking boot, the Long allows for more bend in the knee when fastened on the boot.
review.name: Well Designed and Constructed Trousers

name: Keb Gaiter Long Trouser - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bicycle inner tubes.
review.name: Bicycle inner tubes

review.reviewBody: I commute by bicycle regularly and I have been using Slime sealant in my tubes to help seal annoying punctures. I started using these tubes when I discovered that the valve assembly is removable by simply unscrewing. These are good quality tubes and I've been using them for years now.
review.name: Removeable valve a plus

review.reviewBody: I ordered several Fall 2023 and all the valve bodies leaked when the stem nut is loosened when you are pumping air into the tube.... had to throw them all away and order new tubes from a different manufacturer.
review.name: Valve body leaked - Unusable

review.reviewBody: Every one of these tubes had faulty valves.  Every one leaked air once riding the bike.  Would never purchase these again....
review.name: Horrible Tubes

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the 700 x 20-28mm/80mm option for my carbon wheels. Local bike shops don't usually have them in stock and I'm not a fan of using extenders except in an emergency.

I usually carry 2 spare tubes. Got a flat, valve cores on both spare tubes failed and I went from a cyclist to a pedestrian just like that. Lesson learned... I added a valve core tool (and extra cores) to my repair kit and switched my road pump to a Silca Tattico BT version because it doesn't have a thread-on chuck that will loosen the cores.

I periodically check/tighten valve cores and haven't had an issue since. It's a tube, not rocket science. Probably no better or worse than any other standard tubes I've used.
review.name: Holds Air Most of the Time

review.reviewBody: ... of putting they name on this junk. Exactly as a couple of reviewers claimed here, you have a big chance of getting a tube with the defective valve (leaks air right out of the box). I ordered two tubes, one was kind of OK, but another one was defective. I tried adjust/tighten the core, I even replaced a core with one from another tube, I tried a couple of different air pumps, but nothing helped.
review.name: Specialized should be ashamed...

review.reviewBody: Junk tube. Valve stem cores wouldn't stay in. Every time I pulled the adaptor off the valve stem the inner core would come out. Probably got 100 miles out of it most.
review.name: Junk
comment: The Presta valve core is actually squared off so that it can be tightened with a small wrench.  It has to be tighter in the stem than the adapter is on the core, otherwise, as you found out the whole core will come out with the adapter.
Hi Adam, I am really sorry to hear about this. I will reach out to you to see if we can resolve this issue for you

review.reviewBody: These have always been my go to tubes. Usually inexpensive, light and always get me home from rides where I've flatted. Haven't used any of this years purchased (4). Can only hope they work as good as previous purchases. If not? I'll be one 'very irate' customer!!! Wish me a NO flat summer, please.
review.name: Specialized inner tubes, presta valve

review.reviewBody: I bought a pile of these.  Nothing like unboxing a new tube and finding out the valve leaks air.  Well, except when you unbox another and that valve leaks air, and another leaks.  You get the idea.  Maybe I got a bad batch tubes.  Otherwise, if you find one where the valve doesn't leak the tubes are fine.
review.name: Bad valves

name: Road Standard Presta Valve Tube

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They wear well, last forever and are comfortable, they are my go to for hiking and hunting as well as shoveling snow, I love them.
review.name: My favorite boots.

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Absolutely the WORST hiking boot I've ever owned in my 60+ years. The stitching failed in multiple places on both boots not long after purchasing them. (Many people have the same complaint about this model boot. ) Unfortunately, I didn't keep the receipt and couldn't remember where I bought them. Keen said no receipt, no warranty which I understand. They told me to get them repaired. I did. The repairs are failing in the same places. There's something about this boot design that makes them fall apart. They're comfortable, but falling apart. 

I switched to the Lowa Renegade. Much better quality.
review.name: The Worst!

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my sixth pair of Durand boots . I hike six miles a day in the desert on rocky uneven serfices. I can't wait to take them off, they hurt my feet and ankles. I would like to return them.
review.name: My feet Hurt

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've put over 600 miles in these boots and am satisfied. I've used them for hiking, backpacking, snowshoeing, winter hikes, and everything in between. They've been waterproof and durable. 

My only complaint is the threads have torn in a few places and seems have come undone. The tread still has life so I wish keen would fix these boots for me. Also, these boots are definitely on the heavier side.
review.name: Durable and waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: It's so hard to find shoes for my wide feet and I care a lot about having a nice toe box as well. Comfortable shoes for the trail!
review.name: So comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Having the correct size helps! I purchased a pair previously and ordered my normal size, but they hurt my feet! This time I ordered a wide and it made all the difference! Love my Keens!
review.name: So comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This was my 3rd or 4th pair, the only footwear I wear!!!
U.S. made!!!!
Great fit and very comfortable!!!
review.name: They are the best!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The best investment I ever made over 15 years ago for my feet is with Keen. I never consider anything or anyone else!
review.name: Don't ever change

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've been a steep mountain hiker for 45 years now. 
I have hiked many peaks that are 13,000 to over 14,000 feet above sea level.
Now I live in a wetter climate in the Appalachian Mountains.

So these Durand II are perfect because they are
light weight, give arch and ankle support and are waterproof.

I am a woman and have a very wide foot. I no longer can fit into a woman's wide which is a D width.

 I'm so thankful for Keen's men's Durand II size 7 wide hiking boot. 

Thank you Keen!
review.name: Men's Durand II wide for a Woman

review.itemreviewed: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Seam ripped after 10 times of wearing these boots
review.name: Seam ripped after 10 times

name: Durand II Mid Waterproof Wide Hiking Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: 3/2 La Luna Back-Zip Fullsuit Wetsuit - Women's
review.reviewBody: I cant say enough about this wetsuit. After struggling in and out of a chest zip wetsuit for too many years I was excited to find a classic back zip that is warm and has all the goodies a proper suit should have. This suit is so warm, so comfortable and so easy to get in and out of. Ive eyed these wetsuits for a while and Im so grateful I finally purchased this.
review.name: Best wetsuit ever!

review.reviewBody: My hiking shoe, the Women's Voyager is a wonderful shoe I wear most days and hike in 5 days out of 7. It is both supportive and comfortable and I'm living in them most days. You will love them if you decide to make the purchase.
review.name: Feels like I was born in this shoe.

review.reviewBody: Love these shoes, fit was perfect, no break in time, So comfortable
review.name: Love these shoes, fit was

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much and have lost track of how many pairs I have owned over the years. Great support! I wish there were more color options.
review.name: I love these shoes so

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ordered my usual size and they do run a little large. They are great for me because I can wear heavier socks for the winter without my feet feeling hot and cramped. The shoes are very sturdy, but comfortable. I love the wider footbed - my toes have room to spread out. I have been wearing them a lot.
review.name: Great walking/hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing these hiking shoes for years; don't see any reason to change. They're comfortable and long-lasting.
review.name: Repeat purchase

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best. . Ive tried them all at some point. Some of the trusted brands Ive relied on for decades are cutting costs. . cutting corners on quality and it shows. 
My sister in law introduced me to Keen. . It is the best introduction of my life. I have purchased two pair hiking shoes and boots for myself and a pair of work boots for my son. We demand the highest quality footwear available against the elements. . and have maintained ownership of the highest quality boots for the last two decades. 
I am very pleasantly surprised by the workmanship, materials and construction of this brand. Exceptional comfort and functionality in a good looking respectable shoe. So glad my sister in law shared these shoes with me. I feel like my family will benefit in high standard comfort and reliability from now on. Right out of the box comfort and protection of your feet is the feeling you get here. The quality is superior to everything Ive tried in the world.
review.name: Love these . . tough yet so comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There's nothing to say. Keen's are the best shoe on this planet. Thank you!!!
review.name: Outstanding, as usual!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this shoe. It fits just as well as the other high top shoe of the same style. So comfortable!
review.name: Fits like an old friend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had a pair of these 2 or 3 years ago and they were the most comfortable shoe ever and excellent quality! I just bought another pair and Im really disappointed. They dont look as nice and they sure arent the same great quality as my last pair. The previous pair used a good quality stained leather and these look like they had a cheap paint job and they sure dont smell like leather either. They have a faint chemical smell about them. While they are comfortable enough they feel like theyre cheaply made.
review.name: Not what they used to be

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable right out of the box. Great support for walking and hiking and cool enough even on hot days. I wear the ALL the time!
review.name: Super comfortable

name: Voyageur Hiking Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Ergon SR Sport Gel Saddle - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I did a ton of research on saddles before deciding on this one for my gravel bike. Ultimately I could never get it right?I changed the angle of the seat, the distance to my handlebars, everything. Yet it never seemed to jive with my sit bones. I ordered a S/M saddle, which is what all the fit profiles suggested for me, but maybe I needed the M/L. I don?t know. I ended up having to return this one and going with the Luna by Fizik, and I?m way happier.
review.name: Wasn?t for me

review.reviewBody:
WIth Terry and Prologo,i had a bad lower back, front chafe, and pelvis/leg seam cycling boils.  I can tell you how frustrating it is to stop cycling after 15-20 miles  just because your lady bit is crying and you can no longer sit on your saddle...Not anymore with this new saddle. 

Pros:
1 No more chafing: Ergon has a wider butt seat and a narrower nose with a relief channel. So, my labia-specific problem is gone with this awesome saddle shape. No more back pain either.
2 I got the red saddle. Bright, deep red. I love the color. great quality. sleek design, sleek logo unlike some other bike companies.
3 Comes with matching bar tape. Great quality!
4. Long rides without break-in period. Did a 30mi 2 days ago. Did another 20mi today. That wouldn't normally fly with my old Prologo seat but now i can go all day on my bike without thinking about the pain in the v. 
5. Light weigiht!!! Having compared multiple saddle weights, this is the lightest i can find sub $100.
If you're still unsure:

I am planning on doing a 300mi bike-packing trip. Before, i wasn't sure about my ability to do such a long trip without permanently damaging my lady bit or giving up from the sheer pain. I am now fully confident that i can do it. I finally feel like I can perform to my fullest ability. If you're having similar problems as me, please consider purchasing it. I wish i had looked into this wayyyy earlier to save my past self from all those painful rides!
review.name: LOVE AT FIRST SIGHT

name: SR Sport Gel Saddle - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is by far the best mat I've used for camping, it's honestly as comfy as my bed. Buying top quality gear is always best. Companies like Sea to Summit back their products and that's why I will continue to buy their products. I was just hoping for a repair on my damaged mat, but they replaced it. That is a solid business. Thank you very much. I share this experience quite often.
review.name: Comfort Deluxe Self Inflating Mat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love it, I used it with my girlfriend and it was a nights every single day We used it !
review.name: Super matresss

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We use these in our Class B+ RV. They are easy to inflate/deflate and we slip them behind the couch to store. There is no comparison to the comfort and ease of use for sleeping pads. Sea to Summit stands behind their products. We had an issue after 6 years and replacement was sent immediately! Couldnt be happier with the product and company!
review.name: Comfort Deluxe Self-Inflating Sleeping Mat

review.reviewBody: Purchased this mattress after much research and decided to order it. First camping trip was in May in the mountains of Nevada. Im new to camping and this was super easy to inflate and set up. I love that I didnt need a pump. Just set it up and let it self inflate. I did that first thing and by the time Im ready for bed later its all good to go. I love how comfortable it is and doesnt deflate at all over night. I went camping again in Mount Laguna, CA in July for the second test run with this mattress. Slept really good again and the set up was easy. I also love the bag it comes with to store it in and travel with. Protects it very well and easy to roll up. Camped again shortly after in Big Bear, CA. Seriously cant imagine not having this mattress now. Its worth every penny! I would buy it again and highly recommend.
review.name: Best Camping Mattress!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased two of these in the early summer to prepare for a two week long camping trip with my wife and daughter. First used in dinosaur national monument along the green river. Was around 103 degrees during the day 85 at night. Easy to set and durable. Extremely comfortable, didnt sweat at night everyone slept great! Then moved up to Gros venture along the Tetons. Temp during the day was around 83 night lows were in the mid 40s. We used fleece thermal liners paired with the tanami down blankets. The sleeping mats helped us stay warm paired with other excellent products we got from sea to summit. Everyone loves them and we will be returning customers to see what else sea to summit comes up with in the future.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
This is truly the most comfortable sleep you'll get outside. Absolutely recommend. In fact, I tell people about it because so many people say they don't camp because they can't 'sleep on the ground'. This pad is a game changer for that. The pad self inflates for the most part.. I end up putting a few breaths of air in to get to my preferred firmness. It is ridiculously comfortable. I camp primarily in Florida, so I can't comment on R value or warmth. I also camp from my car, so lugging it around isn't a big deal.. but it is bigger than both my tent and sleeping bag. But again.. not a problem in you have the space.. well worth it! 
I am 5' 5 1/2" and I got the regular, if I were much taller I'd recommend the longer version. Just for comfort.. if you have the space in your car.. why not? I also want to get the double.. because I had to inflate the ole air mattress this weekend after becoming adjusted to the insane comfort of the Sea to Summit pad.. and dang.. the air mattress is only half as comfortable as the Sea to Summit! And I used to like the air mattress. I'm completely spoiled with my camping sleep setup thanks to Sea to Summit
review.name: Best Sleep!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Prepped for use next month. Impressed at this point.
review.name: Prepped for use next month.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is the most comfortable mat I have ever had. Definitely work the money. Its like bringing your bed on camp. Its not the lightest thing however if youre just casually camping like I am and not backpacking around I highly recommend. Another downside is that it doesnt fit in my current duffel which kind of sucks but its not that bad to carry around. Thats on me for not measuring beforehand lol. Its also nice if you are looking for something similar to an air mattress, my roommates friend borrowed it when she stayed over for a few days and loved it.
review.name: Amazing sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and very warm on cold nights. My new favorite pad
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for car camping and I am so glad I did! This is the best camping mattress! Super comfortable, you can roll over and you don't feel like you are rocking a boat! It inflates in no time. A little time to roll it back up, but totally worth it! Be sure to buy the pump to assist in filling as it doesn't come with it and you will want the pump.
review.name: Awesome Mattress!

name: Comfort Deluxe SI Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody:
Biggest flaw: little gravel / rock / dust gets in the shoes super easily and I have to stop very often to remove the shoes and shake it out. 
I find that it's easier to roll my ankle in this shoes. 
The ride doesn't feel like what the price is either.
I've used on road, gravel, and single track trails.
Weight is okay and all my shoes are 9.5 but for this shoe i would have gotten .5 size bigger.
Don't think I'd go with another Craft shoe.

I usually run in hoka rincon, hoka mach, and salomon ultras.
review.name: Does not live up to the price

review.reviewBody: Very hard to put on. I am a size 42 shoe and got the large. Cant zip all the way up my calf. The orange is very visible but thats about all its got going for them.
review.name: Too small!

review.reviewBody: Great shoe covers, but fell apart after the first ride, The toe cap seam started unstitching itself.
review.name: Worked Well, On One And Only Ride

review.reviewBody: I had used them two times in central Florida,  temp 38F and 34 F first day with wind second a day no wind,  I was expecting my feet to get warmth but honestly I just noticed a small improvement, I felt my toes cold all of the time,  I am not sure if this item will work under 32F?  They are nice, comfortable, not too difficult to put them on,  I am 5.7/155 and the top part of the booth are just tight to zipper it , if you have thick legs it maybe a problem there, these covers fit perfectly in my 42 size shoes, in summary I tested for both wind and just cold conditions not totally convinced.   If I need to up date later on I will.
review.name: Not too warmth

review.reviewBody:
I use these size large shoecovers with my Lake size 44 wide summer road shoes and Shimano road cleats. The covers fit snugly. which is fine, but if I wore any larger of a size (even a half size), I think they would be too tight. 

I initially thought these were too small until I figured out how to put them on properly: first, slide the shoe cover on, above your ankle. Then put on the shoe. Then slide the cover down, and pull over the toe area of the shoe first, then the back, and lastly fasten the velcro strap on the bottom. Do not try and pull the cover over the shoe and cleat, when putting on or taking off.

My feet tend to get cold easily, and I can ride in temperatures in the lower 40's (Fahrenheit) comfortably with these. I recently did a road ride in the mid to upper 30's and stuck toe warmer packs to my socks, and I was fine. I do not think I could ride at freezing or below with these. 

Keep in mind they are not going to be as warm as more expensive, dedicated winter shoes (by Lake, 45 NRTH, etc.). These covers do not provide any insulation for the bottom of the shoes. 

I bought the hi-viz yellow ones, and they really stand out, but I do wish they were yellow on all sides, instead of having the black stripe on the rear. I think it is important to be highly visible to motorists approaching from the rear.
review.name: Great shoecovers for cold rides

review.reviewBody:
Got a set of Estremos for really cold temps, these will be for just above freezing up to the mid 50F's.  Used them today in 36-44F and they worked fine.  Undoing the velcro strap underneath the arch makes it easy to get them on and off.

Also checked out Gore's latest shoe covers, made from new fleece-lined stretch Infineum WindStopper.  The Intensos have more substantial material around the edges of the soles. On my set of the previous version of the Gores,  I wore a hole under the front of the left one from putting my left foot down at stops, and the new Gores do not seem sturdier in that area.

The Intensos also accommodate cleats better: the new Gores have a tightly sized hole which unfortunately does not line up well with my cleats, which I have moved back on my shoes.

Downside of the Intensos is that the rear part is black (I got the bright yellow ones for visibility), hard for traffic behind to see.  So I clip USB-rechargeable flashing red LED's (EverLight FX by Apace, $25/pair on Amazon) to the tops of the backs of the Intensos.
review.name: My choice for midrange cold temps

review.reviewBody:
Have worn them 3x now, in both cold (32F) or very wet (43F) conditions without fenders. Paired with a toe warmer on top of my shoe, my feet tolerated the weather in both types of conditions. For cold, the potential drawback is there is not bottom sole (so that it can accommodate MTB/Gravel shoes) so the bottom of your feet may get cold. For wet, even though it's a pretty tight fit at the top, I think water still finds a way in when there is a consistent wet road spray. Finally, I had to size up. Started with a M for my size 41.5 road shoes/42 MTB shoes. The road shoes barely fit but I couldn't get my MTB shoes on. With a size L it's still tight but I can get them on.

In the end, I think it's a good value for what you get. For longer rides in inclement weather, I would recommend want something extra to help these, like fenders or a toe warmer.
review.name: Do a decent enough job

review.reviewBody: I found these extremely difficult to put on and take off. I followed the size guide and got an XL for my size 45 shoes. In addition, they offered VERY LITTLE cold weather protection.
review.name: Difficult to put on/take off

review.reviewBody: Bought a Large, with 43.5 shoes. That should be perfect by the sizing guide, but I definitely could have gone a size up, even with my relatively slim Northwave extreme shoes.  First use, 45F used thin socks and had cold feet.  Second use today; started about 37, and finished at 32 into a fairly strong headwind.  I wore a heavier socks, and put a light Assos shoe cover under these as well.  My feet were ok, but could have been warmer.  These are well made and a good value, but I think the temp range advertised is pushing it on the cold end.
review.name: Not as warm as expected

name: Intenso Ul Shoecover

review.reviewBody:
I have now owned two pairs of these gloves (lost the other pair!!). They are perfect as a liner glove under your main full weather proof gloves or as an immediate access glove rolled up in your fleece pocket, for just in case moments when the temperature drops. 
I love them, well made, thin, but do the job for a reasonable price.
review.name: Great Liner Gloves

review.reviewBody: I had spent ages this winter looking for a good pair of gloves that i could also use with a smartphone. Sick of having to take my gloves off to take a photo / send a message. These gloves are perfect, without a doubt the best gloves ive bought.

review.reviewBody: Great colour , design , warmth and fit . Will be great with new Rab coat and hat!

review.reviewBody: The sizing is fine but the bottles bounce a lot more than with my other Salomon vests - not sure why that is but really noticeable difference sadly
review.name: Bouncy
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: Great fit as is to be expected. Lower back mesh pocket is great for an extra bottle and easy to access on the move. The two zipper pockets are great. The front pockets are a little difficult to access but work ok. My biggest gripe is no used gel pocket. You either need to bring a zip lock bag or just get gel remnants in the vest pockets. Its such a simple add, I dont know why its left off.
review.name: Solid, but could be better

review.reviewBody:
The reason I love this pack is the big mesh pocket on the lower back. Makes it very breathable but can also hold gear. 
Only issue is that the mesh has torn slightly along the edges where its down to the vest. This has happened twice now. 
I wish the build quality was more durable especially for the very premium price you are paying.
review.name: Light but fragile
comment: Hi. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. Were glad to confirm that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and were waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable and incredibly light. Not quite as stable at full speed as my Adv Skin 12 but more comfortable overall.
review.name: Great Vest for Trail Running

description: Buy the MSR Quick 2 Cook Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Quick 2 Cook Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Quick 2 Cook Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Clean, smart design; easy to use handle, great for for my roof top tent camping kit and light enough to use for backpacking. MSR has been a top brand for me since 1994. Still using gear from 30 years ago. Highly recommend.
review.name: MSR gear is as good as it gets

review.reviewBody: Great product. MSR makes some of the best gear out there.
review.name: Great product. MSR makes some

review.reviewBody: Great set for both backpacking and car camping. I like being able to easily swap out the handle between the two pots. Easily packs up within itself for transport and storage.
review.name: Great set for both backpacking

review.reviewBody: This set is one of the very first set of items I bought over ten years ago since I started hiking/camping and yet still being used regularly. It is not perfect, the red plastic ring around the lid handle plastic broke years ago but the lid lift handle itself remains. The bottom of the main pot bumped up a bit but that is acceptable since it is a lightweight design. Everything else are going great. The Talon handle is perfectly rigid and foldable. I recently bought a MSR water kettle and it fits perfectly inside the cook set with the insulated cups removed. I highly recommend this product and would be very happy if I can get a piece of the broken red plastic ring replaced.
review.name: Lasted over ten years and still being used. Highly recommended!

review.reviewBody: Packs well and is light! I love the insulated cups... Game changer.
review.name: Packs well and is light!

review.reviewBody: Would have expected a set this expensive to come with a bag to keep it together and a second handle for the second pot. Handle does not seperate freely, and you may have to hold a hot pot to remove. Anodizing is super thin and already worn after one use.
review.name: Disappointing for the price.

review.reviewBody: Nice quality and design as with all MSR products in general.
review.name: cookset

review.reviewBody: Very good for intended use, but would be great if there was a lid for the 1.3L pot so it can be used separately, or if the lids were sold separately like some competitors offer. Also, if the pots were a little taller so the 1.3L could fit a 100g gas canister, and the 2.5L could fit a 200g gas canister. After paying for this set, I'm looking for something else for solo trips. Very unfortunate.
review.name: Good, lacks versitility

review.reviewBody: I use this kit backcountry skiing and backpacking, with either my MSR Dragonfly or Pocket Rocket. It works great for two or three folks on the trail. I have never have found use for the bowls that are included in the kit. I prefer to take a separate bowl with a lid that I can re-hydrate dried food in or put the lid on to keep food warm while I prepare the rest of the meal. The mugs are useful and nest well. The major improvement that could be made to this kit would be to provide a handle and lid that will pack well with just the small pot. This addition would make this a great kit, with the flexibility to be used as a solo kit. It disappoints me that MSR has chosen instead only offer a separate kit for solo hiking.
review.name: A Good Kit That Could Be Improved

review.reviewBody: Not a review one huh? We use this for our backpacking, raft, & canoe trips, sometimes the whole kit, but usually just what we need. I mean who needs to wash plates, me and my wife are not so domesticated. We eat and cook out of the little pot, and use the big pot only on long trips where one might want to have a ""bath"", we are boiling instead of filtering, or if the river is doing the carrying. I love the mugs, they keep coffee hot, almost undrinkable for the first 20 minutes from boil, the lids don't seal as well as they used to, but these things have hundreds of miles being crammed in a pack. The little pot is about as non stick as you could make it, even after all this use. It's heavy all together, you gram counters can fuss all you like, my 100 lbs 37 year old wife carries this set and likes it over everything else so far and that includes my titanium pot set, from another company that she feels is not ""up to it"" if I remember her words correctly, she hasn't carried it even once always going back to her old banged up MSR set.
review.name: Bought in 08 and have used all or some on every trip since.

name: Quick 2 Cook Set

review.reviewBody: Love the jacket, especially since the hood fits great and blue fabric matches my eye color and goes over my hooded fleece Fjallraven jacket seamlessly. Thanks for the 25% off, amigo!
review.name: A jacket to thrill my baby blues with

review.reviewBody: Very good jacket, sizing is a bit off if you are familiar with Fjallraven.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody:
For the right intended use, this is my all time favorite coat.  We bought 50 of them and had company logo added and gave away.  

This was the single best giveaway weve ever done.

Good as a mid layer or casual mid weight coat.
Pockets dont have zippers.

Fit is true.

The zipper is a little goofy on all Fjallraven coats, but you get used to it.
review.name: Amazing mid layer or casual lightweight

review.reviewBody: Just received this online, not a warm jacket at all. The plus is it looks nice but even with a hoody underneath youll be cold in the winter. I live in Victoria bc, the winters arent that cold either. Im 510 185 and the medium fits good if you dont want baggy clothes like me.
review.name: Very thin jacket.

review.reviewBody: I was drawn to Fjallraven for their nature-driven, outdoorsy ethos. So when I was on the search for an insulated jacket, I chose the Keb Padded Hoodie. So far, it has served as a smart and stylish outer layer jacket. I sized it down for a slimmer fit and it feels amazing! It has adequate room to allow for maximum movement and for base layers and a lightweight fleece, And the slimmer fit will easily fit under a shell. It is windproof, and water-resistant - it is important to note that it is not intended for long exposure to rain - rain will bead off, but any longer than a minute, and water will penetrate the outer fabric. As a synthetic insulated jacket, it is lightweight, warm, and cozy, without the puffy look. The interior fabric is amazingly soft, and the hood, when down and zipped to the chin, feels sooo good around the neck! The double front zipper is a smart feature, and once you develop muscle memory on how to engage it, it is not an issue. Jackets of similar weight and aesthetic are Kuhl's Aktivtor, Arcteryx Atom LT, and KUIU's Kenai. Loving my Keb, and I hope to get years of performance from this smart and stylish jacket.
review.name: Smart and Stylish

review.reviewBody: Wanting an insulated, synthetic jacket, I considered a few name brand companies and decided to give Fjallraven a chance for their ethos. I considered fit, functionality, and style. Fit: a close to the body, slim look. Function: 3-season, in town/on trail versatility, lightweight, durable, cozy and warm. Style: not your trendy puffer silhouette. Between the Expedition Latt Hoodie and the Keb Padded Hoodie, I chose the Keb, in black and size XS. A few notes for potential customers: The Keb is cut larger than the Latt (the Keb in XS fits similarly to the Latt in S). The black is matte, and really a deep charcoal, which I like. The Latt has a puffier loft than the Keb, but as far as I could tell when I tried both, they are equally warm. The Keb is buttery soft inside and out, so it feels really cozy and luxurious, and though it is supposed to be durable, I will not wear it carrying firewood or trudging around in underbrush. The hood when not in use sits easily around the neck (unlike the Latt, which is stiffer). The double zipper is a smart feature, but you'll need to develop muscle memory to zip it smoothly. In the slimmer size, it still is roomy enough for a base layer and fleece mid-layer, and not so puffy to wear under an outer shell - so fit (for me) is perfect! So far, so good. Not the most expensive jacket in its class, but it is an investment, and I hope to get plenty of use out of it!
review.name: Keb Hoodie Wins!

review.reviewBody:
When I honed in on Fjallraven for an insulated jacket, I narrowed the search between the Expedition Latt Hoodie and the Keb Padded Hoodie. I considered several factors: fit, function, and style. First, the fit: I wanted the jacket to be more fitted around the torso and arms, yet have room for a midlayer as needed. Second, the functionality - warm, breathable, durable, and versatile. And third, the style: great in town and on trail, looking extremely capable in both environments, not looking like your typical, trendy puffer.

After purchasing the Latt and the Keb in S and XS, I settled on the Keb XS as it checked off most of what I wanted. The Keb is not as thick and puffy as the Latt, but the two jackets were equally warm and cozy at 55 degrees F with a shirt underneath. The Keb in XS is closer to the Latt in S around the torso, and the sleeves are narrower - which I prefer. The Keb is a softer material than the Latt, and the hood sits and feels better around the neck when not in use. The Latt's hood, however, feels warmer. 

Backcountry's customer service was great, not only in offering advice between the 2 jackets, but they made returning the items easy and pleasant.

I hope to make use of this jacket for may years to come!
review.name: Keb Wins - Thank You, Backcountry!

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this jacket it does  fit nicely and keeps you warm. There is something that buyers need to know about the Keb Jacket is that the material stains easily and it doesn?t wash out. I purchased the chestnut color jacket and want to dinner and wasn?t aware that l had sauce on my hand when l reached for my phone. The jacket got stained and l was unable to clean it.
review.name: Keb Padded Hooded Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Returned jacket because it was literally made of nothing. Extremely small amount of insulation throughout jacket, next to nothing in between the paper thin inner and outer shell. 

Questionable craftsmanship in my opinion from a company that touts their products as being made for lifelong relationships and the outdoors. This jackets isnt worth 1/3 of what they charge for it
review.name: Paper thin - No insulation

review.reviewBody:
Sigh.... so here is the run down. I bought this jacket without knowing the cost, offerings, or really anything else about other insulated jackets. This is a good jacket, but as Ive look around about a year after buying this jacket (I was shopping for a down jacket for lighter warmth, not a replacement to this jacket) I realized that other more performance oriented brands offer more practical jackets for the same, or less amounts of money. With that being said, I still love this jacket and here are my thoughts: 
1) its built right. I have used this jacket through two seasons and it looks fells and preforms like its brand new. I see myself using it many years down the line. Durability is definitely good
2) I am very annoyed by the omission of zippered hand warmer pockets. Stuff has fallen out of them more than once. The zipper chest pocket helps make up for this a bit but still left something to be desired. 
3) this jackets warmth perfect hits what I would call middle weight. Nice as a mid-layer in the winter (when down isnt practical) and a stand alone in both fall and spring. 
4) the looks are next level. This jacket nails style and then some. Have gotten countless comments
5) hood is cozy and adjustable
6) I havent used it for much aerobic activities so I cant comment on how it breaths for that. For day to day use I would rate it at a solid -a.
My conclusion: if you want some urban mid-weight warmth that looks amazing, can also hold its own doing light activities (hiking, walking, maybe some more prolonged trekking), will last a long time if treated right, and dont care about all out technical performance then this might be for you.
review.name: Good, but not great

name: Keb Padded Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Took sometime to wear in initially, but now that I've got them a little worn these have been great. Still can use some minor adjustments, but overall I'm more than satisfied with the purchase. These are coming close to replacing my Fizik R5's
review.name: Great Shoes

review.reviewBody: Run small and narrow
review.name: Run small and narrow

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes about a month ago and still getting used to them. The tongue and offset closure is a little different from what I'm used to but the price was good, the shoe fits comfortably, has a stiff sole, wider toe box, looks really good, and so far, I'm pretty impressed and satisfied. I'll give it a few more weeks to make a final assessment.
review.name: Very Satisfied!

review.reviewBody: Easy to use, good fit, good transfer on pedal stroke
review.name: Good biking shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought the mint color a while ago and got to try them out at my local cycle studio. Super easy clip in and was sturdy. I like the wire instead of Velcro that I have used in the past. Recommend I really like them.
review.name: Easy use no complaints

review.reviewBody: I was actually waiting for this shoe to get back in stock at my local bike shop and after over a month I was done waiting. I found it here at Back Country and couldn?t be happier. Delivery was super fast and the price was actually cheaper than what I was going to pay. Definitely a customer for life. So far as the shoe I am beyond pleased with it. Very comfortable and secure. Super easy to adjust during longer rides. I was warned by a few people to never get a white shoe for cycling but as someone who ALWAYS rocks white kicks I did it anyway. This shoe is super easy to clean not that I find it very dirty if at all in the first place.
review.name: Great Shoe At A Great Price!

review.reviewBody:
These Torch 1.0 shoes wrap my feet perfectly.  No sliding around inside, not too tight, perfect like a glove.  I tried on a lot of shoes from other manufacturers.  There was always some extra material, either on top, or on the sides.  If I pushed on the material, it was as if there was an 1/8 of hollow area underneath.  Not so with these Specialized, perfect fit.

They're light, easy to put on, easy to adjust, and easy to remove.  I love'em.
review.name: Love These Shoes!

name: Torch 1.0 Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody: I love the casual cut and fit of this top. It's not cropped but it's a nice waist length for us shorter folks. I sized down and it is still pretty loose, so definitly size down one or two sizes depending on how you want it to fit.
review.name: Soft!

review.reviewBody:
Wanted a relaxed fit long sleeve that was fashionable enough to wear on the daily but also functional to use camping. This fits the bill! Good addition to my "wicking" wardrobe which includes smartwool merino, etc. Very functional, but not very stylish. 

Bought size S. I'm 125lb, 5'3", 32B waist 27, hip 37. This is a relaxed fit for me, definitely not oversized but NOT fitted at all - perfect. I would consider buying this in another color in a larger size for an oversized look. 

Can't speak to the wicking, breathability, and odor retention yet. Will assess on my next camping trip.
review.name: Cute and comfy! Hopefully, functional

review.reviewBody: I needed a few base layers for a low key hiking trip and couldnt pass this one up for the price. I found it to be super comfortable and wicking. It was also flattering and cute enough to wear by itself with leggings after the days activities. I ended up wearing it 4 days in a row and am definitely going to purchase more colors for easy fall/winter layers. I am usually between a small and medium, I purchased a medium and this fit slightly oversized.
review.name: Buying more colors!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a nice looking base layer that wasnt cotton and wasnt $$$ and this seemed to fit the bill. If you want something that isn't super oversized, size down. I went with my usual size liking the slightly oversized fit on the model but it's HUGE. I did reference the size chart. I will prob keep it as it ticks all my boxes and will match with most things. But I'm not sure it will keep me super warm with how large it is. I plan on wearing a tank underneath. Definitely a great option if you aren't wanting to fork over the big bucks. The Golden brown color is just as pictured.
review.name: Good base layer for cheap

name: Wicking Waffle Long-Sleeve Henley - Women's

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Tapa Cada Dia 22L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tapa Cada Dia 22L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Tapa Cada Dia 22L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have wanted a Cotopaxi item for a while now because I really respect the company and what it does for the environment with their Del Dia packs. I got this for my brother and he loves it!
I decided to snag one for me for Christmas as too! ;)
review.name: Super Good Love the Fit and Style!

review.reviewBody: Great design, comfortable, big enough for what I need it for. Wish there was another little pocket on the inside though. Other than that, great!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Overall great bag, good padding for computer. The only issue would be the drawstring portion. Opening the drawstring to get into the bag should be smoother, as well as closing the drawstring.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Son uses for Junior School. Good quality and durable. Plenty of storage for his books and binders. The additional loops on the outside are great to hang his lunch box with a carabiner. Side pockets are ideal for good size water bottle.
review.name: Great for School

review.reviewBody:
Using for a work bag as I navigate a 200-acre summer camp. It protects my computer, can hold both my water bottle and to go coffee mug, has a good pen pouch, and has a clip for my radio. 
Between my two notebooks and files sometimes handed to me, the 22L feels not quite big enough for what I need to move about the property.
review.name: Almost perfect, but it might be me

review.reviewBody: I really love the color if the bag. I got the tempest fatigue one. Its a great bag for travelling. I recommend it.
review.name: Awesome bag for travelling

review.reviewBody: Its a little smaller than I expected - the bucket style makes it skinny and its hard to get a pair of tennis shoes in. Only other issue is that it is hard to use the drawstring. I wish it had a release mechanism. Overall, I really like it though and I really love the top pocket.
review.name: Good pack

review.reviewBody: I bought it for some upcoming trips to supplement my Cotopaxi Allpa duffel. I havent used it yet, but it should be exactly what I need. I love the draw string closer so it has a few more inches of space if needed from a standard zip close backpack. I love my Cotopaxi Allpa duffel and know Ill love this bag too. Cotopaxi knows travel bags and their stuff is tough and durable.
review.name: Great pack!

review.reviewBody: My daughter wanted a backpack for her birthday and I chose this one. She loves it and says it is the perfect size.
review.name: Great gift

review.reviewBody: The backpack came perfectly packaged. I was so appreciative that it did not come just wrapped in plastic but also in a box. The bag itself was just how it was pictured online- the colors matched perfectly.
review.name: Tapa 22L Backpack-Cada Da Review

name: Tapa Cada Dia 22L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Please update your listing with the correct information. You leave out important information.
This does not direct mount out of the box on all 2020 Roubaix models. You need a shim for some.

Please add this

*If you wish to upgrade to a Future Stem on your Future-Shock equipped bike, please contact your local retailer for the required shim (Part Number: S204800001).
review.name: Needs a shim
comment: This is incorrect. The shim comes out of your old Stem that came with your bike.  It's a regular steerer diameter of 1-1/8.  All future shock 1.5 and 2.0s have a smaller diameter than traditional steerer tubes to account for the future shock.  I just built up a diverge and the future shock came with 2 different shims, and I put on a 5 year old zipp stem on it by placing the shim inside the stem.
I have a 2020 Roubaix Expert with Future Shock 2.0. I'm confused by the comment on needing a shim because it doesn't specify whether 1.5 needs the shim or 2.0? Do you know which is which?

name: S-Works Future Stem

review.reviewBody: only with one month of use and the shoes have already peeled off the sole
review.name: Bad shoes

review.reviewBody: Purchased only 3 weeks ago and the rubber sole on the toe has started to peel off already.
review.name: Rubber sole issues

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes; the colour is perfect for me and they are super comfortable and very high quality
review.name: Best Vans ever

review.reviewBody: Wouldve beena  good show if it didnt have such a narrow toebox
review.name: Narrow toebox
comment:
Hey Ryan
 
We're sorry to hear that the narrow toe affected your experience with the Vans Ultrarange VR3 Black. We know how important a comfortable fit is, especially around the toes!
 
We appreciate your input and will pass your comments on to our design team as we strive to improve our products!
 
Thanks for giving our shoes a try, and we hope to find something that better suits your needs in the future!

review.reviewBody: I've been hunting for these shoes since I first tried them on at the Vans store but they didn't have them in my size. I love the look and feel however the sole started coming apart at the toe after only a few days. I'm extremely disappointed in the quality.
review.name: I really wanted to love them

review.reviewBody: Such cool shoes, fit well look great, my sons second pair he loves them so much
review.name: Such cool shoes

review.reviewBody: I have these VANS in 2 different colors. They are really so light and comfortable.  I wear them everywhere and are great for all day wear.
review.name: My favorite sneaker

review.reviewBody:
Ordering my 2nd pair.  First was a green which they don't offer, so purchasing a Drizzle color.  They breath well and once I tie the laces, I can just slip on.  A bit odd with the material, but very cool and striking.  Get quite a bit of compliments about them.

JP
review.name: Light and airy

review.reviewBody: Saw these at a surf shop and wanted them so bad. They run very small narrow and are uncomfortable. I wore them for a day and now trying to figure out what to do with them since of corse I dont have the box or tags.
review.name: Not a fan

review.reviewBody: Nice shoes. Super comfortable and fits super well.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Great quality and polarization, would recommend!  Look great.
review.name: Great Glasses and Value

review.reviewBody: So light and so comfortable! Great for hiking and everyday use! They are snug but not tight and that's good for me since I have a small head and they go with any outfit!
review.name: Cambria - woman w/small head

review.reviewBody:
I bought my first pair of Sunski's many years ago and they lasted for years. However this is now 4th pair that has broken in the past year and a half. I got these as a warranty replacement for a pair of the Yuba style that cracked below the lens. And while the metal around the lens solved that problem, the ear piece on this one broke right above the hinge just shy of a year. I do live in a very sunny place and wear my shades daily, maybe they are just not cut out for daily use.

I appreciate the warranty, but not sure it's worth it if you have to go through it once a year or less.
review.name: Not made to last :(
comment: Hey! Sorry that your shades broke on you. We sent you an email to help you out!

review.reviewBody: Love love these Sunski sunnies, definitely my favorite style. The square frame looks so good and is well built. The best part is they dont slide down my face when Im sweaty (unlike the Ray-Ban clubmaster style).
review.name: Perfect style that doesnt slip!

review.reviewBody: Love the frames -- comfortable, stylish and lightweight.  Wish Sunski offered these with a lens that allows more light transmission than the amber lenses I bought (VLT rating of only 15%) -- they're just okay for driving, would much prefer something in the 30-35% range.
review.name: Nice but wish there were more lens (VLT) options

review.reviewBody: Great sunglasses. They look good at a good price, and Im definitely planning on buying another pair.
review.name: New Sunskis

review.reviewBody: Awesome, very comfortable, very clear vision. Most comfortable sunglasses I've ever had.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Excellent pair of sunglasses. They look really sharp and are very lightweight. Incredibly pleased with them.
review.name: Just buy em

review.reviewBody: I know most folks rate sunglasses on style beauty and such. For me personally I am more interested in comfort and quality. Although these were purchased as a gift for a 25 year old, that I am sure is interested in style. They are very sturdy and comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable and sturdy

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, high quality materials, lightweight, and looks great
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody:
I love the fit and style. The sleeves are longer than need be, even for my long arms and preferred longer than usual sleeve length. I thought it would do for most moderate temperature days here in Seattle. But I did get cold in it already over a cashmere sweater. I realize water resistant is not waterproof, but I was out the other day hunched over harvesting some mushrooms before they got too wet, and it started pouring, and it went through the coat, then my sweater and cami as well. Ive been stuck in rain before, but never got wet through any water resistant only coat. Fortunately it dried alright and wasnt ruined. Though this would be my main daily coat. Avoiding buying a heavier waterproof coat because I have enough coats already, and doesnt usually get very cold here to need that much warmth. 
Also I normally wear an XS  it needed the S in this.
review.name: Great style! Got DRENCHED in it!

review.reviewBody: I tried several down coats before settling on this. I love the length, and it's quite warm despite being relatively lightweight. The zipper is high quality and I love the elasticized hood. I'm usually a S/M but got large so I could layer. It's big enough but still has a slim look. So far, I'm really happy with this purchase.
review.name: Great coat!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this cost to cover up my bottom and to have something over my head.
review.name: Best long coat ever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like that the jacket is thin but still warm. Doesn't keep out the wind as well as I had hoped but overall a great jacket.
review.name: thin but warm winter jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket - so comfy and cozy.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved the material and how lightweight it is, but yet warm. I'm on the shorter side and this wasn't too long.
review.name: Great fit and look. High Quality.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am rather short & wear xs & at times xxs. This fit me so well & the length not even too long. I just love it & would recommend to women who are petite & tiny. The green is a lovely forest green color
review.name: Great, Warm, Light Weight Coat

review.reviewBody: Fits as expected. Great quality. Length is cozy and additional zipper function from bottom up makes it practical for movement. Not too bulky either.
review.name: Cozy and practical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quality, light and warm. I only give it 4 stars because the fit isn't exactly right for me . I'm 5"3, smaller in the waist and curvy on the bottom so I ordered a medium. It's not as flattering as it would be on someone taller and leaner. But I still love it!
review.name: Great quality! Super light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very disappointed on north face quality!!!!! This jacket is not cheap but quality is very poor!!!!
review.name: Very cheap quality for the price!!!!

Buy the SeaSucker Mini-Bomber 2 Bike Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mini-Bomber 2 Bike Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the SeaSucker Mini-Bomber 2 Bike Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
We've had one now for 4 years and we use it on vacation when we fly with our bikes and rent a car.  Our bikes go in their cases, this gets tossed into the duffel with our other bike paraphernalia and is ready to go when we arrive at our destination.  Then, with a rental car, we can go to any place we want in the vicinity and start our ride.  

The picture shown shows quick release only but there are adaptors straight from SeaSucker that remove the QR and replace it so that 12mm or 15mm thru axles can be used (works very well).  There is also an attachment that puts a steel rubber coated locking loop in the tailgate hinge or the trunk hinge to which you can attach a locking cable.  The other alternative is to remove the rack at the trailhead.  Either is easy and it's your choice - we've done both. 

That said, we've driven a few hundred miles with the bikes on top with this, we have gone at any of the max highway speeds, and it works just fine.  While it wouldn't necessarily be my choice for a rack for cross country travel, if you need a rack that is easy on/easy off and travels well, this is it.  For that, it's a brilliant design.  It works on any rental car.

The suction cups are massive.  Any individual one would be more than strong enough to keep the rack on the car and this one has 4.  I've never had one even loosen up over time.  They're easy to check because there's an indicator on each pump that shows you if it's losing pressure so you can tell with a simple visual inspection.  So no qualms about using this with $14,000 worth of bikes on top.  Use a little  water from your water bottle to clean the roof top under the suction cup and to provide a little extra suction, a few pumps on the suction cup's internal pump, and this thing is really stuck to your car.  Off you go at 70mph down the highway.
review.name: Brilliant for air travel

review.reviewBody: Seriously, I'm going to use suction cups to hold my $6,000 bike on top of my car? No way! So, I didn't - at first. Instead, I hauled around my 38 lb beach cruiser and hoped for the best.  The rack held fast, every time. It has four suction cups, each independently secured, so even if one were to lose suction, you'd still have plenty of hold. The only downside, once you get past the trust issue, is securing your bikes during stops along the road. There's really no way to do so. Perhaps a cable lock through the windows? In any case, be prepared to keep an eye on your bike when you stop.
review.name: Great concept & execution, trust needed

review.reviewBody:
Recently got a new car and didn't want to mount a hitch this time by drilling holes in, and mounting to, the trunk. Thule and Yakima both recommend NOT installing a roof rack on this car. The SeaSucker rack wasn't even on my radar.

SO glad I gave it a chance! Initially I was super sketched out, but this thing is legit. I can grab onto it and rock my car back/forth, there is absolutely no budge. I have left it on the car all day and none of the cups ever lose enough suction to compromise the grab, although I'm still freaked out enough that I regularly check it.

It does require more time/effort than a fixed rack, but it only takes about a minute to install and about another minute to uninstall. No damage to paint, no permanent marks (obviously should have a clean surface when installing).

I wouldn't hesitate for a second to recommend this rack. After actually using it, I am a believer. Usually only carry one bike, whether road bike or mtn bike, but occasionally I do carry two. Time, distance, speed...no problems.
review.name: Seriously Impressive! * ACTUAL USER *

name: Mini-Bomber 2 Bike Rack
