description: Buy the Spyder Jagged GTX Shell Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Jagged GTX Shell Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Spyder Jagged GTX Shell Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is a terrific ski shell.  With 30 years of skiing under my belt, this is the real deal for a resort skier who owns enough layers to want a shell. If you like to hike to the side country, ski aggressively and think about, or dabble in backcountry skiing, but arent ready to commit to a shell for that purpose this is your jacket.  I own a Norrona Trollveggen Pro Light jacket for backcountry and mountaineering.  This is basically the front side and side equivalent.  Its beautifully crafted, with the construction being every bit as premium as Arcteryx, Patagonia, and Norrona.  The shell is roomy, without being overly baggy.  The powder skirt is attached, there are two internal pockets, one mesh and the other taffeta so you can put wet things and other things that need to dry in the pockets.  Very convenient.  The two chest pockets are well situated and easy to use with gloves on. The right chest pocket has a goggle wipe attached in it.  Its a timeless and stylish design.  Simple.  Elegant.  Polished yet unpretentious.  
Zippered arm pocket for the card. Durable face fabric for years of use. Long cut in the back provides comfort and protection. 
The hand pockets are fleece lined for a soft touch and the overall impression is fantastic.  I havent used it yet, (its August)  but have put all my gear on, goggles, helmet, gloves, pants, mid layers and pants, etc and I can tell you this is a great shell. Its every bit as good as the top brands (I have those too) that get reviewed in theBest Ski Jackets searches. 
So whats the knock against it? 
The Hood:  I have a thing for hoods.  Basically, when the wind is ripping, the snow is blowing and there is nowhere to hide you have to hide in your hood.  This is true on a chairlift or an exposed ridge. The hood design is a B.  Its made to fit over a ski helmet and does this very well. It provides good coverage for the chin and cheeks.  Its doesnt turn like the Arcteryx and Norrona hoods which I consider the best, but it isnt far behind and fits a helmet well.  It can cinch down to accommodate a non-helmet fit too and be comfortable and functional.  Its fine and it works.  It just isnt Arcteryx or Norrona hood level.  However, if you are using it for front and side skiing with a helmet Id encourage you to find this a hidden gem and realize that a B hood on an A shell for a great price is better than an A hood on an A shell for a premium. 
If your life depends on the hood then consider the importance of the hood.  If you cant recall the last five times you were thankful you had a hood at all then this is for you. Youll be thankful you have this hood when you need it.
The pit zips are one way and covered in mesh and adequate for resort and side country skiing. Easy to use with gloves on.  Again, not a dedicated backcountry shell.  Works well for front and side skiing. 
The next curiosity about this shell is that it has a mesh back and a soft and luxurious taffeta lining in the front and the sleeves.  However, it feels like a cross between 2 and 3 layer gore tex.  Its a little stiffer than 2 layer Gore Tex, but it is softer than 3 layer Gore Tex and more comfortable to wear.  Overall, its smooth and comfortable to wear and layers terrifically.  
Ultimately its the best of both worlds between 2 and 3 layer without being overly one or the other.  I bring this up because its kind of a different experience when you first try it on.  Feels more like 2 layer, but protects more like 3 layer.  Maybe it will soften with use. 
The cuffs accommodate either an over or under glove and mitt.  
Overall, this is an undiscovered gem in the shell world.  If you need a ski shell, want to layer, and are primarily a resort skier who enjoys other ski adventures, give this a long look.
review.name: Undiscovered  Gem

name: Jagged GTX Shell Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Altra Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These shoes feel very comfortable. i use them mostly for walking and occasional very short jogs. The fit is a little narower than other Altras and the length feels a little longer. I tried half sizing down but they were too narrow/tight. The bad: The materials for this shoe are not durable. I started getting a hole in the left shoe before 30 days and now a hole in the right shoe shortly after 30 days. The hole is where your toes bend in the shoes. I cannot recommend this shoe given the cost how quickly they deteriorate
review.name: Good fit and comfort poor quality

review.reviewBody: Well I saw the writing on the wall and bought 6 pairs of Torin 4.5s and I just unboxed my last pair today. Please, please start listening to the people that were loyal to your brand and it's not just me, I know a lot of people that have changed to Topo but like many of those that have tried the arch support of Topo kills me. I've tried many iterations and models of Altra and the Escalantes and the Torins have fit best altough not sure about the Escalante 4 since I bought mulitiple of the 3 since I liked them and the reviews of the 4 are not as strong as the 3. Have other COMPLETELY separate models if you are trying to get more market share for the masses, but I'm running (didn't know that pun was going to happen) out of options and I so far haven't found another brand that fits better. Hoping you can get back to your roots with the fit that got you a following in the first place. Cheers, Richard
review.name: VF Factory could you please quit screwing up Altra????

review.reviewBody: I was happy with everything on the Torin 7 except for the rigid plastic in the heel. Feels ok with perfectly straight walking or running, but any lateral movement or uneven ground forces the hard plastic in the heel to dig into my ankle below the protrusion on both the medial and lateral sides. Loved the way the Torin 6 and 5 had a soft heel counter. Hopefully on the 8 they can fix this.
review.name: Plastic In Heel Extremely Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I've been testing these out with 5K tempo runs. The fit is familiar as I started in Altras with the Escalante Racer (6/5 would recommend). Despite fitting well I found other Escalante models (2.5 & 3) to feel like running with planks on my feet. The Torins show very little of that problem so far. The midsole feels responsive but not cushy or bouncy. The energy return seems fairly low. Generally I don't mind these things but I am having doubts about making them my marathon shoe. I wish there was a standard footshape version of the Vanish series. Make it so! I've worn the Provision 7 and found them to less responsive but to feel a little more cushy compared to the Torin 7. The fit of the Provision was slightly tighter in the toebox and overall not quite right. Enough to be uncomfortable over a longer run (10K+ for me). So far the upper is fine. Heel hold is good. Midfoot feels secure but not constricted. I have not had them long enough to note much else other than they are all PLAIN. I hope you are hearing this a lot. Altra, you need better color options. Think brighter, go nuts, give me more COLORS. I'm tired of black, white, grey, black & white, and maybe green. You actually did that with the Escalante 4!!! (Which I'm looking forward to). End rant. Torin 7: 4/5. Could be a 5/5 with some of that Ego Pro midsole. Make it so! -Tode
review.name: Familiar Fit

review.reviewBody: The Torin line (I've had iterations 6 and 7) is one of my favorites for running and general use. That is, while they last. Both pairs have literally started falling apart inside 4-6 weeks of wear.
review.name: Perfect, while they last...

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable show with great cushioning. I trained in two pairs of the Torin 6 version for a marathon and have found my forever brand. Normally a size 13 in most brands, but a 14 in Altras.
review.name: Fantastic show, Altra does it again

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of Altra Torin. I love how they feel on my feet. There really is no break in period. They feel great right out of the box. I dig the new color options! Need more Wide Options colors.
review.name: 3 pair of Altra Torin

review.reviewBody: Lovely feel but had to buy bigger size (US12 vs US10.5 for Newtons). Would love an even wider toe box as I have bunions. The cut and comfort of the Torin 5 Leather is my ideal. The Torin 7 would be 5  if the toe box is as wide.
review.name: Almost perfect road running shoe except for ...

review.reviewBody: I have only been running in these for the last couple of weeks, but I love them so far. I run long distance, and my feet feel great due to the wide toe box and ample cushion. Love them!
review.name: Exactly what I needed!

review.reviewBody: The torin has been a favorite of mine for years. I've had 6 pairs previously. I skipped a few generations based on poor feedback and decided to try again for the 7. The width is not the same and narrow
review.name: So close but not the same. Disappointed.

name: Torin 7 Wide Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! Theyre fully waterproof, so walking in water is no problem. Also super easy and quick to wear no need to tie anything, which makes them perfect for outdoor adventures. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great for outdoor activities

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear these every day for my 2 mile hike with my dog Gabby. I don't worry about slipping on loose rock or wet feet when the trails are slushy. And my feet and so comfortable. The look is sharp as well.
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Its my first Salomon pair. Ive worn it since this spring at the workplace. Its so durable and comfy.
review.name: Comfy!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These hikers are pretty good, they hold my foot in place and are for the most part comfortable. They do rub one of my small toes and dont have the best cushioning as mentioned by other reviewers but all in all Im happy with them. I would not use these on a long 20 mile hike but shorter hikes are good.
review.name: Fairly good shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Theyre so comfortable and very satisfied with my purchase. I normally buy a size 6, which I did with this purchase, but find them the fit a little wide.  This is okay as winter is coming and thicker sock will take care of this issue.
review.name: X ULTRA 360 EDGE GORE-TEX

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ive been wanting a pair of good walking/hiking boots for a while and these are them!!!! Theyre so comfortable and very durable! I love them especially the bungee laces!
review.name: Amazing!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very disappointed, I have big blisters on the inside heels, due to the poor design of the inside sole. That's a shame for pair of shoes at this price.
review.name: Bad insole

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super comfy, really pretty, and so easy to put on and maintain. Real waterproof and great quality overall.
review.name: Love them so much!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The design is poor! I have worn Salomon hiking shoes for a decade. They were always dependable but lately they are not. This shoe is finally not black, I had to wait a long time as its been sold out. Now it arrives and the inside sole is swooped inward A LOT and the shoe is rubbing my inside sole terribly. Just walking around the house. What is going on Salomon??? I buy a pair every year and I compared this one and it dramatically swoops in at that one point causing pain.
review.name: Bad design of swooped insole is painful

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Incredibly disappointed. I've only hiked about 30 miles of very mellow terrain in these and they already have holes and are creasing so badly. I was really hoping to use something less robust than boots for shorter hikes. Maybe i'm just a boot girly, but I'll stick to my lowas which have lasted me many years and hundreds of miles in the rockies.
review.name: Not for me.

name: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use these as my light winter boots and they work incredibly well for this. They're warm but not so much so that I'll be sweating when it's close to or just below zero and they're waterproof which is great when walking through slush. I think if you were to try to use them for summer hiking your feet would be unbearably sweaty but I have not tried.  Toe box is very roomy. I'm a big fan of Altras and their wide toe box and these come close to that level of roominess.  Highly recommended!
review.name: Excellent light winter boot

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these hiking boots about a month ago and I am happy with my purchase. Delivery was quick and price was great! The fit was exactly as advertised as they did run about a half size smaller than a typical 8.5 .  I will definitely use backcountry again for any other outdoor  equipment purchases!
review.name: Exactly as promised!

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Very stable 
I ruck with around 30 pounds; very comfortable 

Definitely order a half-size up.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the way these boots fit comfortably from day one. I bought my first pair in 2017 and took them on day hikes on trails in the hills. They were supportive, thanks to the mid-height, and had no break-in period. Since then I have purchased several more pairs and wear them every day. I usually keep a brown pair and a black pair and alternate them. I usually walk on pavement, about a mile or two per day, and a pair worn every other day lasts me about eighteen months before the bottom starts to show that it has worn through the black part. I ordered my seventh pair from BackCountry just before Christmas and expect it to arrive today. I recommend them to friends. They are also good for my plantar fasciitis -- I replace the original insoles with SuperFeet.
review.name: Fabulous waterproof boots for everyday

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots run a full size small. Waited a week for them, now have to return. Frustrating.
review.name: Run a full size small

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: My third pair. Outlast any other brand that Ive tried. The leather breaks in & is they become my most  comfortable shoes. Soles provide reliable traction in various conditions. BDry keeps my feet dry.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love pretty much everything about these boots. Other hiking boots I've tried in this price range include Salomon X-Ultra 4 Mid GTX, X-Ultra 3 Mid GTX, various Merrell hiking boots and shoes, and The North Face waterproof hiking boots. The Oboz Bridger Mid B-Dry blow them ALL out of the water in terms of quality of materials, worksmanship, and especially durability. These boots have served me well for about a year now and could easily last another couple of years. I am a landscaper by trade and wear these to work five days a week, and often for walks/hikes on the weekend. They've held up extremely well to my heavy usage. I'm telling you, both pairs of Salomon boots I owned fell apart faster than I'd expect a pair of Wal Mart boots to do the same. These Oboz boots are different. More comprehensive review below...

The Oboz Bridger Mid B-Dry are made from quality materials, including leather with high-durability rubber in key places. They are plenty comfortable while also being HIGHLY supportive. Immediately upon trying them I could tell they were a lot sturdier and more supportive than all of the others I'd tried up to that point. The insole felt high-quality by comparison. These boots are TRULY waterproof (within reason) while still being breathable enough for hot summer days in the high desert. The rubber wrapped around the toe area and heel area of the boots seems to have done a ton to make these boots last longer. The sole of the boot might look strange at first glance, but I've found it a great and versatile sole shape. I've worn these on all terrains in all weather while doing landscaping work. I've worn these on hot days, in torrential downpours, and also all throughout cold winters with heavy snowfall and ice. Somehow they manage to be breathable enough in summer and warm enough in winter with proper socks, and are still effectively waterproof. In summary, if you are looking for possibly the best combination of quality, comfort, support, and durability in a hiking boot under $200: these are very likely the best value waterproof hiking boot out there. Working as a landscaper is one of the best stress tests for a boot, and this one excelled. IMPORTANT NOTE: these absolutely run one-half size small. I'm normally a size 11, I ordered these in a size 11.5 and it is perfect.
review.name: Favorite Hiking Boots Under $200, By Far

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very nice boot, but this hiking boot runs small. I wear a 12 in almost every shoe but these boots are tight at the toes they are very narrow. 1/2 size up should cure it. Excellent quality, well made. Just letting people know for future purchases to go a 1/2 size up.
review.name: Oboz Bridger

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm hard on my hiking boots, having hiked more than 10,000 miles in the past ten years in places known for wrecking footwear, such as Arizona, Australia, and Pennsylvania. And Oboz Bridgers have held up better than any other hiking boots I've owned. Durability-wise, my last pair lasted more than 1200 miles. Traction-wise, I often pass hikers half my age on steep descents due to this boot's aggressive outsoles and deep heel brake, which dig into loose surfaces really well (scree, gravel, mud, etc). Comfort-wise, Oboz features upmarket insoles, solid foot support, and plenty of cushion, which works well for my messed up feet and ankles. We all have different feet and prefer different kinds of hiking. But the Bridger is my go-to boot for moderate to difficult hikes that require solid foot and ankle support.
review.name: durability, comfort, traction, & value

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I tried Merrells in a store, and thought "they feel great." I decided you never know, and headed somewhere else from there. I tried on these Oboz, and was mind blown! That was two years ago. 
I have not had tons of time for hiking, I have only hiked in these several times. 
But, for my planter fasciitis, I have worn these boots 6 to 10 hours, 4 to 6 days per week, for the last 2 years, taking steps, with very few breaks, walking, usually on hard tile, or roads.  
I sometimes even work out in these. Lol
With that said, 2 years later now, they are still keeping the planter fasciitis arch problems under arrest!, and they are still odorless. lol
Thank you Oboz. 
I still brag about them,
I LOVE these boots.
review.name: I have planter fasciitis

name: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's
Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Lite Camp Cot
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helinox Lite Camp Cot online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was pressing my whole body weight on it (130 lbs) and it's very difficult to compress the aluminum cross bars. This makes it near impossible to assemble and disassemble the cot. The Helinox Cot One is heavier but has much better aluminum cross bars where there's a lever to release and also lock it in place (if you look up an assembly video for the Helinox Cot One you'll see what I mean). 

Once I've finally assembled it, you kind of feel like you're sinking a bit (my shoulders feel like they're rolling forward) and I'm only 130 lbs. I'm surprised given how much tension there is created by how stiff the aluminum cross bars are. It's light for a cot, but not nearly as light as the Thermarest inflatable pads (e.g. Neoair XLite or XTherm). So I feel like it's the worst of both worlds. It's not as light as the inflatable pads, but because it's meant to be "ultralight", the lever locking mechanism is removed making it very difficult to assemble. It's better to either go with an inflatable pad if weight is what you care about or if you really want a cot, get a slightly heavier one with better aluminum cross bar mechanism. 

This is just a me problem, but I also assumed it would be breathable from the photo. It looked like the fabric was a mesh, but it turns out it's just a solid piece of fabric with a grid pattern. The fabric is not very breathable.
review.name: Very difficult to assemble/disassemble

review.reviewBody:
I booked a recent fall hunting trip where the outfitter informed me we would be sleeping on ground pads. I bought the Helinox lite camp cot and was greatly pleased! Not only is it light weight but the bulk of cot and light weight mattress was a lot less then the bulk of foam pads packed in on mules. My sleep was amazing on this cot! Will be buying one for my wife as well. This is the best outdoor product I have bought in years! 
If I could make one recommendation is that the cot would come in a couple of inches wider.
review.name: Rob Arnaud

name: Lite Camp Cot

review.reviewBody:
Awesome looks, great quality but. . . . .
They fit big! I'm 6', 185 lbs and ordered a large. I'm definitely going to exchange for a medium. Return process has been tough with postal strike but Bridget that I've been dealing with is super helpful!
review.name: Throw the horns but order a size down.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm 5'11" about 200 pounds. Stocky shoulders and legs. These pants fiy very comfortably, especially with crash pants on underneath for my size. A belt is needed for comfort as they are just barely not too big on my waist, but most Large gear has been tight and not given me room to move. Baggy without snowboard boots on, so I just cuff them once with regular shoes while not riding. Great pants, durable and stylish!
review.name: Cool Style, Fit as Expected

review.reviewBody: Large had a longer inseam than size chart. Back pockets not useable as they are almost impossible to get Velcro closures open. Have only worn once, but so far warm enough with just long Johns underneath. I had to put metal bike hoops (used to keep pant legs out of chain) on ends of pant legs so I could walk without having pant drag in mud of parking lot.
review.name: Good but watch sizing.

review.reviewBody: Great pair of boarding pants for a good price. No bells and whistles but gets the job done fine!
review.name: Solid and affordable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My boys love these pants. The adjustable waist was nice since they were a little bigger in the waist but he needed the medium for length.
review.name: My boys love these pants.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Im 510 and 200lbs. I will usually get pants in medium or large (32x30 in jeans). After reading the reviews on these, I was surprised to see people saying that I should order a small. I havent worn a size small in anything in years. Sure enough, I got a small and they mostly fit. They fit in the waste but were a bit snug in the thighs. It felt like I could rip them if I squat down too deep. The length and lower legs were great. The fit made me believe that a medium would assuredly be too big. 

The pants are great. The sizing is just weird.
review.name: Very oddly sized

review.reviewBody: Perfect solution for my teenager who comes out on occasion. Great look and fit for something so basic
review.name: Best basic pant around

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants! Pretty warm, and a nice fit. I'm not a fan of the super baggy style, and these are great, a bit tighter in thighs, but with plenty of room to move and lots of space in the lower leg for boots. Zip pockets are great and the leg liners that tuck in to your boots are awesome. Sizing feels accurate, I wear 32x30 pants and the Medium for these fits great (a tad long, but perfect with boots on).
review.name: Simple and ideal

review.reviewBody: Great fit! and the size is right and the look is straight fit
review.name: Great fit! and the size

review.reviewBody: Great pant for the price. Much warmer than expected with the interior lining. Used them on a 7degree day with a proper first layer with no problem. Not too baggy or too skinny. Straight leg fit. Would buy again.
review.name: Snowboard pant.

name: Standard Shell Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Dual-Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these due to a pinched nerve in my hand. They're super comfortable and breath well. Didn't have any numbness or discomfort. The quality is just okay though, lots of loose strings. I got the larger as I have large hands and I found that they fit pretty snug but there's a little slack in the fingers, not a big deal though.
review.name: Super comfortable but QC is just ok

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Dual-Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Quality gloves. White, as expected, stains near instantly on first use. I could still use my iPhone without taking them off, which is helpful. For XXL, I was expecting a tad larger, but comfort was good for a 25 mile ride. Will see what 7 days riding in Croatia feel like!
review.name: Nice gloves. Still small for XXL

review.itemreviewed: Body Geometry Dual-Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: These gloves ripped within 15 miles of trail riding.  The suede nose wiping feature is very thin and ripped after being caught and released from a branch.  I don't recommend these for MTB, especially when they cost $40.  My Dakine gloves are much more durable at less than half the price.  I'd give the gel 3.5 stars.  I think the gel distribution could be better.
review.name: Not durable

name: Body Geometry Dual-Gel Long Finger Glove - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the KUHL Thor Fleece Pullover - 1/4-Zip - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is a lot more than a fleece. It is a highly wind, resistant, warm, and tough piece of clothing.   I tried it as a second layer under a ski shell the other day and its great, but it is a fairly rigid piece of clothing, and I prefer to use it as outerwear on a cold day with a pair of jeans.  Its extremely tough you could do yardwork in it or a lot of times when Im going to and from the mountain, it is my go to gear stepping in and out of my truck loading and unloading my gear    It is highly wind resistant and breathe this really nice with Breathable patches under your arms

The fit is interesting. I normally wear a medium at 55 and 162 pounds. But this piece of clothing has large shoulders. Thus I move down to a small and it fits great.     Ill try it again under my Arcteryx shell but again I like it as an outer where peace.  I could see skiing in this on a warmer day with just a vest as well  

Looks wise it looks great
review.name: Tough piece of Kit.

name: Thor Fleece Pullover - 1/4-Zip - Men's

review.reviewBody: The helmet color gives me the visitability I wanted. The fitting is very simple. You can actually put the helmet on and adjust by turning the dial to fit your head.

review.reviewBody: this is a warm helmet. Good for winter. Not enough vents for summer time riding.
review.name: this is a warm helmet.

review.reviewBody: I always have high expectations from Smith products and it never failed. I bought it for my daily use on a E-bike. This helmet is light and good fit but I recommend that one should measure their head circumference and then choose size. My size for any helmets brands; bike or motorcycle has always been Large so I bought large but it is little bigger to my head for which I have to fully tighten the adjustment dial to not let the helmet move. Next purchase I will make sure to buy M size. Other than that the helmet is good and the grey suits. My daughter loves it and has a grey copy of her own. Once in a while I get comments from the people, I like your helmet.
review.name: I like your helmet.

review.reviewBody: I love the bright yellow of this helmet color. It is very comfortable. Thank you!
review.name: I love the bright yellow

review.reviewBody: Nice light weight with a great low profile look. Fits perfectly matched to the size index. Love the light grey color. Has good ventilation as well. Paired well with my Super73 RX.

My order was a present for my other half.
And He adores his bike helmet!
Its light weight, the fit was exact and he gushed about how comfortable it was.
I was blown away with how easy it was to order and receive my package.
Will definitely choose SMITH when it comes to my turn to get a new bike or snowboard helmet!

review.reviewBody: By far the best value helmet Ive used. We have a few different models of mid-tier BD and Petzl helmets, and the Camp is the most comfortable of them all.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
Just used this helmet for a 3 week climbing trip in mountain and alpine climbing and am very pleased overall with it's performance and fit.  Based on other reviews saying it was too small I went with the larger size option and it fit well. I had previously owned the black diamond half dome helmet and that helmet would always shift around on my head, this helmet has a much better suspension system, material construction, and tightening system that keep the helmet comfortably secure all day without any shifting around as you look up and down while on route. It takes impacts well as tested when a large dinner plate of ice fell on my head while on a AI3 route. 

The only things that could be better about this helmet are: 

1. weight - it's on the heavy side, you can definitely feel it, but at this price it's acceptable. I also was looking for a hard shell helmet for alpine and multipitch trad that can reliably take abuse for years and this helmet will certainly meet that.
2. color - can we please get something more neutral? gray -good, orange ... not my first choice.  But in the gear industry it's all about flash and flair i guess...
review.name: Great helmet for the price

name: Titan Climbing Helmet

review.reviewBody: LAST TIME I BOUGHT ANYTHING BY THE NORTH FACE: THE JACKET IS NOT MADE WITH POLARTEC ANYMORE LIKE THE PREVIOUS YEARS - IT IS MADE WITH SOME RAG THAT FEELS AND LOOKS LIKE EXACTLY THAT: A RAG - SHAME ON THE NORTH FACE, BEEN A CUSTOMER FOR 25 YEARS AND WILL NEVER EVER BE COMING BACK AFTER THIS
review.name: GARBAGE!!

review.reviewBody: The fit is nice with this jacket everything about this jacket is nice! Accept the is doesn't have a hem string around the waist to cover up from the wind! Columbia has the same jacket same quality but cheaper and with a hem string which is real nice and convenient!
review.name: Nice jacket but same jacket w/waist hem and cheaper Columb

review.reviewBody: Such a dope fit, keeps me warm. TNF is the quintessential outerwear company.
review.name: Highly recommend for those who look for cozy outer

review.reviewBody: My new favorite light jacket. Warn, superb color, best fit, awesome design. I would make this purchase again without hesitation.
review.name: My new favorite light jacket.

review.reviewBody: Nice weight similar to the apex bionic I bought 5+ years ago. I like the hooded option to help cut down on wind. Only wished the grey was a little lighter.
review.name: Replacing my older jacket.

review.reviewBody: There is no cinch on the waist to adjust the waist size. There are no velcro strips on the wrist and the wrist are wide. Not sure why they removed the velcro and cinch, weird. Material is good. Protects from wind and rain.
review.name: Bit disappointed

review.reviewBody: Is great , alternative to a sweater and coat but it feels i am wearing bubble wrap, maybe is just me. It does keep me warm but i doubt is a snow day thing to wear alone.
review.name: Two in one.

review.reviewBody: My 15 Year Old Grandson Loves His Jacket He Says That It's Warm And He Stayed Dry When It Rained
review.name: I Would Buy This Again

review.reviewBody: It is a great satisfaction of comfort and convenience to enjoy these garments at all times, in any season of the year here in Cabada they are my best allies to enjoy these hoodies. I enjoy them very much North Face my brand par excellence. Jorge Florez Hslifax ns Canada.
review.name: Amazing Hoodie start five .

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect high quality jacket for my young adult son! I can always count on TNF quality gear!
review.name: Yes on purchase

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very good quality, just little narrow because I am use this to snowboarding
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice bibs, the quality is really good, also the style is awesome
review.name: Bravo one

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great design and fit. As a more muscular build, I did have to size up (M -> L) to be able to wear a layer or two underneath.  

My only complaint is that the shoulder straps could have had a wider adjustable range.
review.name: Awesome bib with well thought out features.

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super good quality, a perfect GTX bib for outdoor activities. Love the pocket gear bands and the inner gaiter, very thoughtful design.
review.name: Omni-use pants

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: love it had it on for some days already nice pocket and everyrhing
review.name: best bibs so far

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good for snowboarding, very well constructed than my burton bib, but more a tight fit when it comes to boots. Barely cover my boots, way too skinny and tight. Overall decent product
review.name: good

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Generally well thought out and high quality set of bibs.  The pocket and zipper layout is fantastic, and the fit is very good.  I had to size up to large from a medium, but I tend to fall on the cusp of both sizes (so not irregular/unexpected). My only area of constructive criticism is in regards to the shoulder strap/velcro system - than range of adjustment is limited, and the bibs could have benefited from having a little more velcro to go smaller or larger.  Other than that, I am pretty happy.
review.name: Great set of bibs, worth checking out.

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The only thing keeping me from ratting 5 starts is the cuff is a hair small for ski boots,especially if you have a heating battery for your custom insole.  Fabric is great, the rest of the fit is fantastic for skiing and movement.  I'm 5'8"and about 185lbs these days.  Big hips, and they fit great in the lage. I have a feeling these bibs were designed for ice climbing more than skiing which is probably why the cuff is a little tight.  Over In very happy.  Great pocket layout as well.
review.name: Great pockets and fit for me

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great pants for winter hiking if you want bibs. Nice material that looks and feels very durable. However, I bought them for skiing and the lower pant is too narrow to go over my ski boots well, a little too tight. My friend bought them and he has heated insoles in his boots so a little battery back on the outside of the bott at the top. He has to leave the lower section unzipped to get the pants to come down over the boot. 
And I am 61, 190 lbs so I bought the large regular length.  Fit great but suspenders are too long and wont adjust short enough for me. Also, not found of velcro adjustments on suspenders. Those little metal slides work much better and dont weigh much.
Lots of pockets that are great and handy!
review.name: Great Pants Except maybe for skiing; Pockets Galore

review.itemreviewed: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased these to replace a 15 yr old pair. New G-tex pro is well constructed to their highest standards, Awesome full side zips on both legs with drop seat capabilities when nature calls. Several shells on market only have thigh vents,but when its warm full zips are the way. Internal boot gaitor is a must also. Only complaint would be make articulated knee areas for high stepping and poss a bit wider thigh area for same reason. Also poss a thin waist band belt to snug up that area, for when not wearing pack or harness. Uses for ski touring and ice climbing. Pockets do not interfear with harness. Thank you, highly recommend
review.name: Gore-tex pro bibs

name: Routefinder GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms SolarFlex Guide Glove - Men's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SolarFlex Guide Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms SolarFlex Guide Glove - Men's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Didnt use them yet hope they help my hands against peacocks next November in Brazil. Ill let you know lster
Perfect fit, no bulges, secure hand protection for 12-hour days throwing heavy flies to savage fish!
review.name: Protection for hands in wild places

review.reviewBody: My 2nd pair of these. Won't be my last. Great in fringe seasons and even sunny winter days.
review.name: Love em!

review.reviewBody: These gloves are a total hand saver. Handling fish with extremely sharp gill plates becomes much easier on your hands and makes it easier on the fish. Releasing much stronger and livelier fish. Great for preventing sun damage to the back of your hand, also.

Great glove for flats fishing large species.. They don't last very long though. I get about 13-15 tropical days out of a pair and then they are falling apart. Great while they last though. Wish simms would use better stitching... :(
review.name: Good and bad

review.reviewBody: Stitching started to come apparat after one day of use.
review.name: poor quality

review.reviewBody: cold and wet    weather   they aint made for >>>  what are they made is my question....????

The gloves have a nice fit and I was very excited to use them. However, I have only used them in 3 fishing days and the striping guard part of the glove is already worn out and the material has a hole in it in that portion of the glove. I thought it wouldve lasted longer. The grip the glove provides works well on a rod that has a synthetic golf grip handle but feels insecure on a cork handle unless there is moisture on the glove. I thought I may have the rod fly out of my hand the first time I tried it with a rod that has a cork handle. That said, I do like how the glove fits my hand but I was disappointed about how quickly the stripping guard wore out. I thought that may happen over the course of a season but not in 3 outings.
review.name: Good fit, stripping guard material needs improvement.

review.reviewBody: They survived well during a weeklong BWCA trip, even keeping mosquitoes at bay at camp. No sunburn, no paddling blisters, and I kept cool - would buy again!
review.name: Excellent for BWCA Trips

review.reviewBody:
I opened the package and was stoked.  There was leather and leather reinforcements in all the places where I've worm gloves like these out in the past. I put the right to work.
It was disappointed how quickly some stitching started blowout.  After 5 days of use the leather palm and the were coming apart where some stitches were not holding.  I fully get this is a challenging marriage of lightweight stretchy nylon and a supple but durable leather.  I was disappointed. 
I bumped up my rating because online customer service was great!  I was able to start an exchange online, got printed a shipping label and now how my return going back and the replacement pair headed my way at the same time.   If everything goes well, I'll have these guide gloves in hand as I head on a multi-day trip.  If my hands are happy, I think the folks in the boat get a better experience.  Thanks
review.name: sad about the stitching but HAPPY about the quality customer service

name: SolarFlex Guide Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Saris Fluid2 Trainer Smart Equipped online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fluid2 Trainer Smart Equipped
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saris Fluid2 Trainer Smart Equipped online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Was gifted this for Christmas this year and had it set up the next afternoon. Took less than an hour to get it set up with bike attached and I am not someone who typically does my own work on my bike so removing the rear wheel was a new experience.

Clear instructions, easy to follow. The most confusing part was trying to understand how to affix the included speed/cadence sensor to the rear wheel hub.  The instructions for this are small, and images were not helpful but once I figured out the steps, it was easy.

Was up and riding a couple training rides on Rouvy, using the included free month trial code, by mid afternoon.  

First impression is that I will be happily using this daily at least.
review.name: Easy Set Up!

review.reviewBody: Bought this a year ago and have used it over the winter months. The trainer is great, provides constant and even resistance. I would HIGHLY recommend a trainer specific tire, as anything with a tread will be noisy. The included Saris Speed Sensor is awful and I ended up purchasing a different one to provide the feedback I wanted.
review.name: The trainer is great, the speed sensor is HORRIBLE

review.reviewBody: Very happy with my purchase, this trainer is quieter than expected.  Its easy to set-up, installing your bicycle on the trainer is simple and Saris even supplies a metal skewer.  I should of made my purchase sooner!  I wish it would come with 2 sensor strait in the box?
review.name: Winter training

review.reviewBody: After quite a bit of research into the somewhat confusing world of indoor trainer reviews I purchased this trainer with the speed sensor and have been very pleased with my decision. Combined with the Rouvy app I am able to get a great workout virtually biking around the world.
review.name: Buying was a good decision.

review.reviewBody: I like it.  Took weeks to get the attention of the support team to get the sensor working.  But the trainer it self is good.  I can watch TV at a reasonable volume while riding, it's a good workout.
review.name: I like it.

review.reviewBody: Customer service was great and fast! I got the bike trainer 2 months ago and Im loving it!
review.name: Great Features and Service!

review.reviewBody:
I have owned a Fluid 2 for 6 years, it has never skipped a beat.  The speed sensor let's me log mileage and speed via my Wahoo Element for my indoor workouts.
Most important is the lack of power limitations of this trainer.  Unlike many of the smart trainers that freak out after a 5 minute block at 400W+ , this unit maintains it's resistance no matter what, even if you spoke beyond 1000W during your sprints.
review.name: Solid and reliable trainer

review.reviewBody: I've had my trainer for about a month and I use it 3 or 4 times a week and I just love it.  It was super easy to set up... the hardest part was getting my bike down the basement stairs.  Easy to use,  connected easily with the apps that are out there.
review.name: So easy to set up

review.reviewBody:
For a basic trainer, its awesome. I have used it for about a month and its fun, quite and exactly what I was looking for .
Saying that the sensor needs to better. It does not work as cadence but great as speed.
review.name: Fluid trainer

review.reviewBody: Speed/cadence sensor is trash, disconnects more then my dial up in the 90's
review.name: More of a dumb trainer
comment: Sorry to hear you have had some connectivity issues with your sensor.  Our Customer Support team should be able to assist with some troubleshooting as there are many variables to consider in your set up when using sensors, smart trainer, and indoor riding apps. Please feel free to reach out to them at support@saris.com (24/7) or 1-800-783-7257 (M-F 10am - 3pm CST).

name: Fluid2 Trainer Smart Equipped

description: Buy the Lowa Innox GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Innox GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lowa Innox GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Innox GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these a size bigger than normal because I wear thick socks for hiking. They are comfortable and wide enough for my feet (I like wide toe boots). But the insoles are not glued in and on my right foot, it was moving half an inch within the first few minutes of walking, which was very uncomfortable. My boyfriend superglued the insole in, but if I'm paying this much money, this shouldn't be something I have to deal with. I haven't done a long hike (over 6 miles) with them so the jury is still out. But they are very supportive around the ankle. There is not quite enough cushion on the insole on rocks, or so it feels now. Lowa needs to glue these insoles and make them a little thicker. The first day wearing them to the market they hurt my feet. But they are worked in a bit now and I tried them on a 6-mile hike and they were good. I wear wool socks for cushion and it's very hot - no airflow. I liked my La Sportivas for comfort but they came apart really quickly. Things are made cheaply now and hopefully these will last a bit. I think these Lowas are true to size but can't be sure.
review.name: Insoles not glued in, hard sole, run hot

review.itemreviewed: Innox GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love love love the Innox Pro!  It hugs my foot so well, and feels like a sock.  I feel supported, without the bulk of bigger boots.  Such a great product - can't say enough!  10-12 Miles a day trekking in Switzerland for a week...  the Innox Pro handled it with ease!!
review.name: My go to for hikes and treks!

name: Innox GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the raglan sleeve. Not baggy. Perfect under a fleece
review.name: Nice work-out shirt with quick wash and dry.

review.reviewBody: Love these shirts! The feel and fit is super nice and hard to find.
review.name: A maroon color would be perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these shirts for comfort, style, and fit.  Stretchy and feels so nice to wear.
review.name: Comfortable and great fit!

review.reviewBody: This is my third Windridge shirt. Tough and durable.
review.name: Favorite shirts for gym, hiking, and biking.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like the quality of this shirt. I like that it is a little bit thicker than most "active" shirts. It breathes well and still keeps me cool on a hot day.
review.name: A Quality Shirt that Wears Well on a Hot Day

review.reviewBody: Im a Marmot boy. Whenever is the sale on the first to be there. This shirt is a prime example This shirt is typically double what I paid for it. I love the fact That you can wear it on chilly days and for workouts
review.name: John Hoving Ho

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The large is perfect for me at 63 and 175 lbs. and I appreciate the raglan sleeves which make a very comfortable fit.  This shirt makes an excellent base layer - gives me that little extra in warmth while having excellent wicking properties.   I also love working out in this shirt - it washes really nicely and doesn't get stinky.
review.name: Perfect base layer and t-shirt

review.reviewBody: Seems like the material keeps getting cheaper and cheaper.
review.name: Go back the the quality 7 years ago.

review.reviewBody: Wow... I'm shocked. This is my favorite synthetic shirt. The fabric is great. Great looking, great feeling, great durability. Simple styling makes it super versatile. I wear it to work as well as my days off. Breathable enough for all but the hottest days. I love this shirt.
review.name: ONLY 3 STARS??

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ive been hiking Utah for years. And practicing yoga do I need a boot with room for my yoga toe spread. Im currently in New Zealand on a 3 week hiking trip. I tried ten different hiking boot brands prior to trip and chose these after much consideration. Theyve been fabulous   Comfortable and supportive and grippy. Room for my toes. Did pretty well in 80 inches of rain in 4 hours. However I am going to purchase the higher gotten style for next trip
review.name: Best hiking shoe ever

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Hello backcountry team, my boots are no longer working. The seams have torn and water is leaking in. 
What should I do for the guarantee? After one year they look 5 years old :(
review.name: Nice but after one year

review.itemreviewed: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was initially very happy with these boots, having switched from a Merrill pair which were too clunky. These are handsome, comfortable and nicely supportive. They have a secure fit but there is room for my toes to breathe. If they did not have the Waterproof label I would have no complaints, but it does say WP, and they are NOT WP. Walking through a very wet field, the top of toe was soaked through. This was not immersion, just wet grass. and my socks got wet. It is disappointing. I may see if a spray will help but why do they advertise as waterproof?
review.name: Comfortable but Not waterproof

name: Alp Mate Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Picked this up for a new ski shell. So far I love it. Fit is great, color pops just right, pockets are large and well placed. This will be my new resort and backcountry shell and probably around town wear as well. Excellent job BD
review.name: Awesome Ski Shell!

review.reviewBody: Fits great, but material is stiff. The neck area is stiff and can be uncomfortable when rotating you head. Hoping that breaks in only worn it twice. The skin pockets on the interior are a nice feature for backcountry adventures.
review.name: Great fit but stiff material

review.reviewBody: Love the fit, stretch, and overall streamlined design of this jacket. Everything you need, nothing you don't.
review.name: Great ski shell

review.reviewBody: I love this shell, its great. It is comfortable to move around in.
review.name: Great shell!

review.reviewBody: Too new to fully give a review but this is my second one and I sized up for layers. First one was mostly worn under a ski patrol vest and worked flawlessly. Super bright red color so toned it down to brown and went bigger this time for more bc use. Sheds water and chairlift grease w nice flexibility in the shoulders. Chest and arm pass pockets are great. The hood is massive and will fit over different helmets.
review.name: Too new to fully give

review.reviewBody: Thick fabric, deep pockets, sleek design, and bomb proof zippers make this my favorite jacket in the last 5 years (coming from Trew/Flylow/Patagonia/686).
review.name: Best of the best

review.reviewBody: Ive bounced between Trew, Flylow, Patagonia, Arcteryx, and the North Face for years now, this jacket and the Recon bibs are the best fitting and most durable kit ive used so far. The fabric is soft and thicc, definitely holds out the AK winds and variable conditons. This stuff was definitely designed by folks who ride: big pockets, burly zippers, and adjustable everything. Size up for steeze.
review.name: Best around

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, burly strong, and waterproof. Amped on this shell.
review.name: Nice Cut

review.reviewBody:
Fits perfect as the size mentioned. The isolate is unreal.
An interior zip pocket would make an 11/10 jacket
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: awesome shell! works amazing for backcountry. The stretch is great for mobility.
review.name: perfect

review.reviewBody: These shoes look incredible but unfortunately theyre very narrow. I ordered a size up at 14 because I like to double up on socks. Couldnt imagine how tight they would feel had I ordered a 13. Wish they had these in a wide!
review.name: Narrow

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love these boots. I recommend these 10/10. I'm curious how the summer will go because they are pretty warm for the feet. The irony is that the suede can get dirty in the winter just given the weather. However, the look, the feel, comfort, whole nine of these are certified super heavy duty mega fresh. Would buy again.
review.name: Best purchase of 2024

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good looking comfy shoes for cooler weather weekend getaway. Might need ticker soles when carrying heavy backpacks for extra cushion. Got the grey color which looks good on pretty much anything you wear.
review.name: Super comfy shoes for all day walking

review.reviewBody: Shoe does not support the ankles .... too wide !
review.name: Unsupportive

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable. I'm thinking of ordering another pair in the tan color.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these chukkas. Super comfortable, build quality seems like they will last, easy to keep clean. They have almost an Ugg feel to them. But they look nice, I'd wear them on a date. I would have liked to have had a little more toe space but chukka style shoes in general typically are tighter where the tongue meets the toe.
review.name: Like walking on clouds

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted a warm, lightweight shoe for winter. My winter shoes and boots are too heavy for everyday use. These are warm and very comfortable. They're not marked as waterproof but they shed water very nicely. I would buy them again but in a different color. The color is orange, yellowish, not a real tan.
review.name: Yes, very nice shoe

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looks a bit bulkier (wider) than I had hoped, but fits well and comfortable. I'll plan to treat the suede with waterproofing spray prior to use; and hopefully it lasts.
review.name: A bit bulkier than expected

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my BF trying to convince him to wear house shoes. He is now obsessed with them. He can't stop telling the world how comfortable they are and says it's like walking on air. I wish they made a girl version.
review.name: Best purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They're a bit wider than pictured; but fit really well / are very comfortable. If they last, it'll be an awesome buy. Will keep you posted. Thanks!
review.name: Really Happy thusfar...

name: NSE Chukka Suede Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva TC Extreme Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like the zip up fleece gaiter. The traction the shoes provide on my home wall is excellent.  I dont have any tiny edges so I cant comment on their edging but they keep me on even the smallest of Metolius foot holds on both my vertical wall and 20 degree overhanging wall. The weather has not been cooler than 50 yet when I climb so I cannot comment on warmth yet.  They do seem to stretch. I wear a 43 in the TC and bought a 42 in the TC Extreme.  I have worn the shoes a half dozen times on my home wall so far and some stretching is occurring.  I like the shoes but might have wanted them in my 43 size.
review.name: TC Extreme

name: TC Extreme Shoe

hasVariant.name: Pro 1/2-Gallon Jug
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Pro 1/2-Gallon Jug online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: So easy to clean with wide opening. The rubber "sock" on the bottom makes it easier to unscrew the top.
review.name: Great water jug

review.reviewBody: Good quality water jug. Ice lasts for a long time.
review.name: 1/2 Gallon Water Jug

review.reviewBody: Product works as good as it looks. Construction and design was well thought out. This is a jug that will last for years to come.  I gave these out as swag for my safety committee members.
review.name: Well Made Product

review.reviewBody: Im in the construction field and often work in houses with no air condition on hot days. This keeps my drink cold for a solid 24 hours.
review.name: Built like a tank!

review.reviewBody: I had an older Coleman plastic one that Ive had for years and it recently started to leak as I poured or drank from it so I wanted a new one and when I saw this Coleman Pro 1/2 gallon I knew it was just what I wanted. I just returned from a 3 day tent camping outing and this Coleman Pro kept my lemon aid cold for several days.
review.name: Coleman pro 1/2 gallon

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Non-slip grip or boot on the bottom of the jug. This is a tough jug, it's ideal for job sites. Has a clip or anchor point so you can hang the jug on the wall or anywhere off the ground. My water stays cold all day, even when out in the Texas heat. It helps me to make sure I'm staying hydrated while on the job.
review.name: Can handle a rough environment

review.reviewBody: I've put this through the ringer the past week and have become a fan. It's pricey, but worth it. The silicone pads the bottom and will hopefully prevent the dents/scratches I have on every other bottle I've had.
review.name: Bomb Proof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My family loves the Coleman Pro Stainless Steel 1/2 gallon jug.  This product is easy to use with the handle for carrying and the easy access spout. The bottom is coated with a silicone product that saves your bottle from dents if dropped.  Overall a great choice, very durable.
review.name: Trusted brand!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've probably dropped it a million times and have yet to break it! We use this for our travel ball trips. It keeps the water cold and ice frozen the whole day. And it looks very stylish. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice strong jug, can withstand a fall and still be fine. Keeps my water cold all day with a nice strong handle. Good for hiking or just everyday use. Have not tried for warm liquids but im sure it does great there too.
review.name: Strong and durable

name: Pro 1/2-Gallon Jug

review.reviewBody: I absolutely loved the pattern when I saw this online but was hesitant due to the other review about it not being good quality. I took a gamble and bought it. I was pleasantly surprised with the skirt! Color looks just as good online. Super cute and good fit (true to size). Flattering length (slightly longer than I expected but not in a bad way). Good quality. I was hoping it was a skort but with the slightly longer length, no worries. Love it!
review.name: Cute and flattering

review.reviewBody:
Ordered my usual size which would have been adequate, except right out of the bag, I noticed several defects in stitching or things I didnt like/fading looking spots along the stitching??

Fabric itself was was nice, soft and stretchy
But the big black mis-sewn spot in the front was a big downer. The faded spots along the waistline also disappointing. Didnt even try it on.
Usually love Kavu, have used many pieces through the years, but quality on this was lacking so have to return. Sad
review.name: Cute but poorly made?

review.reviewBody:
As the other review pointed out, the main zipper is small but I've never had any issues and it's been through thousands of miles.  Plus In my experience many lightweight  puffy jackets have very small zippers that are worse than this one.   I love ortovox gear but their prices are ridiculous.. that said, if you wait you can find great deals. I got this jacket new for 70 bucks!  Their retail prices imo are crazy!  Congrats to those that can afford them.. but for me I've always had to look for deals.  
This jacket is super ul, size large and about 10ozs.  Also, I think they made various improvements this year and most ortovox gear comes with at least a 2 year warranty and in many cases 5 years to lifetime.  I love the big pockets on this jacket and how comfortable it is.. it does run small.. I usually wear a large but this is very tight in the arms and shoulders..(6'1 170lbs athletic build)  if you can find it on sale, it's definitely a great option for a Ul jacket.
review.name: Good lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these jackets a couple of years ago.  Barely worn either.  The zippers on these expensive technical jackets are flimsy and prone to breakage.  Ortovox, a European Manufacturer won't accept returns except through Backcountry and Backcountry will tell you that you must return the product directly to Ortovox.  When I complained, they told me the jacket was "out of warranty" without examining the jacket (I sent photos).  Don't waste your money on a technical jacket that is prone to failure because of poor construction and cheap materials.  The jacket was great but the zipper was the cheapest that I have ever seen on a technical piece of gear.  Not worth the risk!
review.name: DON'T BUY THIS JACKET!

name: Swisswool Piz Boe Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Butterfly Camo Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Perfect for toddler who likes to play in the mud! Like that he can pull them on by himself.
review.name: Perfect toddler style

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Butterfly Camo Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Pretty sturdy and cute! Sides are a bit floppy which was a little funky for my 2 year old but they do the job.
review.name: Pretty cute

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Butterfly Camo Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These are the best spring boots for toddlers! My granddaughter loves them!
review.name: Toddlers love them!

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Butterfly Camo Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: We just received these boots yesterday. As soon as my daughter put them on she slipped twice which is completely odd for rain boots. They came with some kind of oil on the bottoms, I guess to prevent them from cracking but I think customers should be warned. I wanted to return but she really wanted them, once we walked on the side walk the grip was great. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR BABIES OR TODDLERS LEARNING TO WALK. Stick to the previous model, we owned that pair and never had that issue.
review.name: Boots should come with a warning

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Butterfly Camo Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: The perfect rain boot for my toddler to pull on and off herself. We wear them all the time! It's her favorite shoe.
review.name: Easy on/off for toddler

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Butterfly Camo Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Great for my 2 almost 3 year old! They are the perfect height so he is able to walk comfortably. They are also light weight but have been keeping his feet dry from all the rain and muddy puddle jumping. Would definitely recommend!

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Vantage 26L Endless Promise Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Nemo makes great gear.  I agree with others that this will be a great personal item for travel and for hiking/camping.  It seems really well made and is comfortable. I like the big back pocket and big zipper pocket.  It is a really roomy pack.  There are minimal organizational pockets so we'll see how it goes if I try to use it for work or one of my kids steal it for school.  It does have a sleeve for laptop which is in a great spot.   Sports for pens, chargers, cables, small bottle of ibu, glasses cleaner, are sparse.  Also, no water bottle pocket which is probably the biggest down for me.
review.name: Excited for this Backpack

review.reviewBody: I recently bought this pack and am happy that I did. Great organization and can fit plenty of gear as well. I find myself mostly using it as a carry on and also for day trips to fit everything that I need.
review.name: Perfect for what I needed

review.reviewBody: Got my hands on a friend's. The expandable storage and is great, and the tech compartment fits my laptop and a tech organizer. It doesn't have a ton of pockets which I like more since I can use my own organizers. A burly build that I can beat on
review.name: Active Ready

review.reviewBody: This backpack has it all. I plan on using this for adventures and flying.
review.name: All in one backpack

review.reviewBody: I purchaed the Vantage 26L in black and love the design, build quality, and features of this backpack. It is my go to backpack for traveling and meets all my nneeds for an extended weekend jaunt.
review.name: Awesome Backpack

review.reviewBody: Bought this bag for daily commute to the office and work/play trips, and I couldn't be happier with the design and performance. Storage was well thought out with nothing wasted. No more searching through endless pockets, no more water bottles falling out and rolling around on the floor of the plane, no more wet gear if you get rained on. Recently had it loaded up with a 13" laptop, 11" iPad and a bunch of stuff for my 2 year old son, for a family vacation that involved flying across the country. The large front "stash" pocket saved us in the airport when I needed to stuff extra clothes, jacket and wipes into it on the run between gates. I highly recommend this pack to anyone looking for a new commuter/travel pack capable of handling any and all situations.
review.name: Nicely Done Nemo

review.reviewBody: Having flown with this bag several times, it is an amazing travel bag! It has tons of room and allows me to keep thing organized.
review.name: Great Bag!

review.reviewBody: Ive been using my Vantage 26L for over a month now. I use it for an overnight bag as well as carrying tech products. At first the straps seemed flimsy but the CCubed technology feels just as durable and comfortable as traditional foam straps. Looking back I might have opted for the Chai color over the black. All in all Nemo has done it again and I support purchases of their products
review.name: Vantage 26L Endless Promise (Black)

review.reviewBody: I ordered this pack to supplement other 22 liter soft packs that I currently own. I was looking for something a bit more substantial with a variety of padded sleeves to carry my laptop /ipad, etc. I am very impressed with the quality of the Vantage 26L pack.  I am looking forward to my next flight to put it to the test.
review.name: Daypack Stuff Hauler

review.reviewBody:
I bought this backpack for traveling, specifically, a trip to Mexico. I had gone back and forth on a couple different bags, but settled on this one. I am glad I did. The 26L was the perfect size for what I was looking for. Something big enough to carry a couple books, laptop, chargers, etc. for the plane ride, then once at my destination use as a day pack. 

The pack has an ample amount of pockets for organization of your freight. Smaller pockets for things like wallet, passport, etc. and then larger ones for bigger items. I really like the larger outer pocket that expands with side zippers. It is great for carrying an extra jacket/sweatshirt, shoes, or snorkeling fins.

Fit/finish and build quality are great, bag should last a long time. Looking forward to taking this pack on future trips.
review.name: Great Pack

name: Vantage 26L Endless Promise Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Escape Kit Bag LT 50L Duffle Bag
review.reviewBody: This is a great bag, mid sized (I already have a 120L large one) and I like the bright orange colour. My one irk is that the shoulder straps to use it rucksack style are really flimsy and don't have much padding or support, wish they had used the same system as the large bag. Instructions to attach those straps would also have been helpful
review.name: This is a great bag,

review.itemreviewed: Escape Kit Bag LT 50L Duffle Bag
review.reviewBody:
As expected from Rab a great with only one negative from me. 

First the positives. Size is bang on! Not too deep, not too long. The pockets are really well thought out. The zip solid pocket on one end is great for toiletries and small items. The elastic mesh pocket at the other works well for a waterproof or misc gear/ clothes. I really like that the inside life pocket is also a solid lining as it keeps books, magazines, and paperwork safe. 

The materials and stitching are top rate. 

The straps are comfortable however, I wish they were a more regular design running from one end of the bag to another. On this version they taper off to the side and getting the hand hold central to swap between rucksack and hold-all mode requires annoying strap adjustment.

Minor point on a great bit of kit overall.
review.name: As expected from Rab a

review.itemreviewed: Escape Kit Bag LT 50L Duffle Bag
review.reviewBody: Fantastic kit bag. Carry handles double as rucksack shoulder straps. Single large compartment. Smart enough for 5 star travel. Tough enough for expedition use.
review.name: Fantastic kit bag. Carry handles

name: Escape Kit Bag LT 50L Duffle Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Rover 45L Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is the shoulder strap, and the plastic hardware it utilized. I was incredibly surprised at the substandard quality allowed by MR this go around in my opinion. I once bought a simple ~15L "gym bag" style pack, yet the should strap hardware was metal, appeared to be stainless. So, although I did use the strap this trip and it did not fail, I firmly believe if my bag would have been heavier, it just might have. I am thankful that at the very least the webbing is sewn wide enough to use D rings to secure and utilize a shoulder strap when the plastic fails or breaks.
However, a good bag for road trips, flights, etc where you don't want to use traditional luggage. Fits nicely in overhead of airplane. Can secure outer YKK Zippers with locks as well. Water/moisture resistant hardy outer material. Able to easily compartmentalize within.
review.name: Checks the box

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my kids to carry-on travel with.  They are well made and minimalist style pack. A collapsible water bottle pouch would be a nice feature to have on future versions.  The main compartments are wide open and dont have dividers - this could be a pro or con depending on how you pack.  The shoe pocket is big enough to hold GTX style boots.  They have not been used much yet, I expect it will hold up well.
review.name: Another quality bag, well thought out!

review.reviewBody: I travel international and domestically every month so I decided to give this bag a go to alleviate using two carry ons. Absotutely the right bag! Great storage compartments and easy configurations for carry! Highly reccomend
review.name: Best travel bag

review.reviewBody:
I received my Mission Rover bag.

I initially liked the old wax version because it looked a bit more dandy than the new one.
So I asked here to clarify the differences between the old wax version and the new one, but it's hard to tell exactly what the differences are other than the material and color.
Now that I have the bag, I don't have the old version so I can't tell all the differences, but the build quality of the new version is very good.
And the design looks even better in real life.

The water repellency of the material is so good that it looks like a pool of water.
And the design of each compartment is very convenient.
The shoulder and waist straps are also comfortable enough, though not as comfortable as a mountaineering backpack.
The fact that you can hide the straps altogether and use it as a duffel bag if needed is a huge plus.

I'm particularly impressed with the YKK zippers, which open and close smoothly. 
I think it will be much more convenient to use than a hard carrier.

The front laptop compartment, which I was worried would be a bit small, fit my LG GRAM PRO 17 with ease.
The width, height, and thickness are all just right (keep in mind that even though it's 17, it's designed to be very compact and slim).

I'm very pleased with this product and I think it will only get better with age.
review.name: Superior build quality and convenience

review.reviewBody:
Ive been waiting for a month to write this review, because my last month was PACKED with travel and I wanted to road test this bag. 

As someone who travels for a living, I use a lot of different bags and cases, from hard case Pelicans to soft goods like Mystery Ranch and North Face. Ive been looking for a bag like this for short trips to carry on my luggage, and was considering the Cotopaxi version of this bag as well. 

Im here to tell you that the Rover was the best choice. 

Besides its great design, ballistic construction, and quality materials (looking at you YKK zippers), the thought put into this bag is what makes me really happy. The backpack straps are great, but being able to put a shoulder strap is so helpful when having another backpack on. You can whip this thing around and take it off with ease. Not to mention the laptop pocket with all of its features. 

This is a perfect one bag for the trip kind of luggage. Im sure the other sizes are just as capable, but for a 64 man, this is a great size for an extra pair of shoes, a packable coat, and all the clothing you will need for a week (if youre a smart packer).
review.name: Perfect Puddle Jumper

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a month long trip to Germany. We used the trains and trams to travel and I lived out of this bag the entire time. We went all over the place in Germany and this pack kept all my gear and souvenirs safe and it comfortably rode on my back. I will say it was a little warmer than other backpacks when on my back, but I expected that as this is duffle more than a backpack. I was very happy with this pack and its ability to travel.
review.name: Awesome Travel Bag

name: Mission Rover 45L Pack

review.reviewBody: In Japan we have this activity literally translated shower climbing where we climb upstream. Similar to canyoning, but different direction. Anyway, I used this on my backpack strap while climbing a waterfall and not a single drop was inside under its force. Amazing. The only downside would be a mounting system where I would like to have something burlier, but I wont downgrade my review because I was searching for something like this for years and my use case is a bit extreme. I like that it is well designed so I could DIY something more robust to hold it in place with ease. Thanks for this great piece of gear Osprey.
review.name: This thing is great
